Reviews.Title: “Really far away from everything”
Reviews.Author: NorwegianKebler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while in town for a tradeshow at the McCormick place and while technically in walking distance, you should really get a cab. The rooms are big, but the hotel does need a make over in the not to distant future. There is really nothing close to this hotel, so unless you have a car, be prepared to take a cab. There is a restaurant and bar connected to the hotel and the food was OK in the bar. There is also a deli that is supposed to be open at 7:30 AM but that is a hit and miss. And with no other options close to the hotel, it is very frustrating. If you are in town for a tradeshow at the McCormick, save yourself some frustration and stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly Staff, Free Parking & Nice Value- Bad Breakfast Cafe”
Reviews.Author: tmm_travelsforfood
Reviews.Content: Though I would prefer to stay in a different neighborhood, South Loop is the best choice (by far) if you need to stay on the South Side. The property is very well kept. The rooms are decently sized, and all was nice and tidy and clean. The staff was very polite, and the parking was free- with unlimited in-out privileges. The on-site breakfast cafe was horrible- bad selection and really strange staff. I was waiting and waiting to be acknowledged by the staff so I could check out and get on with my busy day. After a few minutes of literally just standing there being ignored, I left the items at the register and spent my money elsewhere. The good news is that there were quite a few breakfast options nearby. If South Loop provided an alternate option for breakfast or fixed their little cafe problem, I would gladly leave 5 stars for the value and overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location-close to Downtown”
Reviews.Author: tgcomn4u
Reviews.Content: I had to unexpectedly go to Chicago & since I no longer live there I needed something nice but inexpensive. I went through on hotwire.com & blindly paid for 2 days @ $68 per nite. I had never heard of this hotel but I was pleasantly surprise not to mention the free parking & wifi contributed to my liking greatly. The rooms are huge including jacuzzi tubs in bathroom. It comes with a small well a tall refrigerator but no microwave. The only I suggest is not to stay on Saturday bc there is a club/lounge & sports bar & you won't get a lot of sleep until it closes after 2am...other than that I have no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Good Room But Missing Extras”
Reviews.Author: Memphisdoug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend for our visit to Chicago. We had a traditional king room which was very large and clean. No complaints at all about the room except for the shower head that was one of those low flow types that barely gets you wet. The free gated parking was also a nice added addition. Our only concerns were with the restaraunts and gift shop. When we arrived on Saturday the restaraunt, coffee shop and gift shop should have all been open. We just wanted a quick bite to eat so we were planning to go to the coffee shop. It was closed and no one seemed to know why. This forced us into the restaraunt. The food there was good and reasonably priced but service was slow especially considering we were one of only two couples in the place. We were going to pick up some snacks at the gift shop on the way back up to the room but it was also closed even though it was supposed to be open at that hour. The next morning we went down to eat breakfast at the coffee shop but it was once again closed. Again, no one from the hotel knew why. The restaraunt was also closed due to a private party later in the day. We ended up checking out and finding another place to eat on our own. Overall I would still recommend this hotel - just be aware that you may have to leave the hotel to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly pleased”
Reviews.Author: Shauny874
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel this past weekend because my husband and I had parties to attend Friday and Saturday night. We usually stay on Michigan Ave but wanted something closer south and with parking. After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor we booked here for the 20% off fall promotion on 2 nights stay. This hotel is right on 26th and State which, growing up in Chicago was a cause of concern but that quickly disappeared once we arrived. The lobby is nicely decorated and there are shops inside. Our room was very large. I wasn't a fan of the decor and the bed was a bit hard for my taste but that's just personal taste. If I had a gripe, it would be that the shops were never opened and there is a fridge but no microwave in the room (that made no sense to me). We will definately stay here again while visiting Chicago. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “A fair deal if you don't mind the location”
Reviews.Author: erezn
Reviews.Content: This hotel makes a good and fair deal as long as you don't need to stay close to the heart of down town Chicago. It is located about 10 minutes walk from the McCormick center so it is a good option if you are about to attend a conference at this huge meeting center. Otherwise, look for a place which is located a liitle bit closer to the "city".

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected find: great location and price”
Reviews.Author: JoyceInDC
Reviews.Content: A family outing (celebrating the "century mark" of the family matriarch) led me to this venue. After much research and comparison prices of downtown/Loop hotels to accommodate 200+ persons, The South Loop Hotel was chosen. Located near Chicago's McCormick Place** (and nearby expressways), it was easy to find, get to, unbelievably priced ($99/night vs. $185/night); $40 pp for a tasty buffet-style dinner (3 entrees, salad, vegetables, unlimited beverages) vs. $75 pp for the same, and FREE parking (NOTE: Loop parking - usually valet - averages $35-$40/night). I thought the lower prices meant a lower quality, run down hotel in an unsafe neighborhood (?), but I was proven wrong. This 5-story hotel offers a surprisingly bright, well decorated lobby area with welcoming professional staff, rooms with small sitting area, refrigerator, and (requisite) flat screen tv; business center and deli/sundry on main floor. Meals were tasty. Rooms were clean. Not sure what else I would have asked for. No; it's not on Michigan Avenue, but that's okay, too! I would definitely consider returning in the future. CAVEAT: Saturday night crowds for the hotel 'dance club' can be somewhat noisy, but Chicago's finest are on site to 'keep the peace'. **I would assume that this hotel attracts alot of convention goers.

Reviews.Title: “A really cute place! Stay here, you will be impressed.”
Reviews.Author: JAXtravel
Reviews.Content: I was really not sure what to expect when I booked the Chicago South Loop Hotel - from the pictures, it didn't look like anything too impressive and the location didn't seem too hot, but the price was just right. From the moment I walked inside to check in, I had a good feeling that I had made the right decision about where to stay in Chicago! I was surprised at how chic and sassy, yet very friendly this little hotel was! From the outside it seemed something like a "Hampton Inn" but on the inside this was a classy, young, swank place! The staff was extremely friendly and quick to help with any request I had. I was hungry, so I grabbed a bite to eat at the hotel restaurant and was blown away by the flavor and quality of the dishes! On some nights, they have live music, and other nights they have an open mic night with local jazz musicians to come and play - but don't worry, although the party goes until late at night, you can not hear the music from the guest rooms, I was right above the lounge on the second floor and I didnt hear any unwanted noise. If you stay here, you will be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of Space & Free Parking”
Reviews.Author: czadco
Reviews.Content: The lobby was really clean and looked very much more high quality than I expected for the price. Upon arriving at our room it appeared to be clean and included a refrigerator. There was a small sitting area with two small couches and double beds, which was perfect since we were not really close to public transportation. Typically I like to stay closer to the trains, but parking was free and there is not much going on in this neighborhood so I probably won't recommend walking last at night alone for the average tourist.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep on weekends 'til after 2 am”
Reviews.Author: Gabriele314
Reviews.Content: Pros - we picked this hotel for the price and the free parking. The area around seems a bit deserted and there are no amenities, stores or attractions in close proximity. We were pleasantly surprised upon our arrival by how nice the hotel lobby looked and appreciated the gated parking. We had booked a room with 2 queen beds and that's what we got - it was a spacious, clean room with TV, mini fridge, coffee maker and a wonderful soaking tub, beds quiet comfortable. The next morning we found a little deli in the hotel and the counter person could not have been any nicer or more helpful. Cons - Front desk staff seamed disinterested and were just borderline friendly. Unfortunately our room was located on the 2nd floor above a bar that turned club on the weekend and faced the street which was noisy. Friday nite we noticed loud music and noise but it was not too overwhelming. Not so on Saturday, we got in after midnight and the 1st thing we noticed were people roaming the lobby and hallways, even on the 2nd floor when we got off the elevator. Upon opening our room door is was apparent that the club was in full swing and the music was so loud it made the floor vibrate. We called the front desk and they assured us they will take care of it, which did not happen. They also offered to relocate us to a new room, but since we were checking out in the am we did not want to go through the motion of packing & moving in the middle of the night so we had to wait it out until it closed at 2 am. So if you're planning on staying at this otherwise nice hotel for the price over the weekend, do yourself a favor and request a room opposite the bar/club.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: I know I'm going to enjoy my stay at a hotel when the staff at the check in desk is friendly enough to joke around with you. We booked a King Deluxe room that has an extra sitting area. The price was very reasonable ($113 a night, booked right before we got there) since we were there for the RSNA conference and every other hotel jacks up their prices to be $150+ (Best Western) to $400+ (Hilton). I wasn't willing to pay that much for a regular hotel that required paid valet parking and I would still have to drive or take a shuttle to get to the McCormick center. If you aren't traveling alone, the walk from the hotel to the center was very short and safe enough. As a girl, I would not walk it alone at night but would still feel completely comfortable with walking it in the day. It only took us 10 minutes to walk to the West part of the center. The doors are open even though it was not in use during the conference so it was not hard to get to the Lakeside center. I was also able to park my car right in the courtyard of the hotel which was fully gated and required a key card to get in. I could even see my car from our room window. The first thing I noticed when I walked into the room was the layout. I didn't think having an extra seating area would be anything special for the extra 10$ a night but I liked it! It was large enough for us to sit there and eat comfortably while keeping it separate from our sleeping area. The room had a large mini fridge and a coffee maker. It did not have a microwave but the staff at the front desk was absolutely wonderful and microwaved our left overs for us. We went to Joy Yee restaurant in Chinatown our first night and had soo many leftovers. The food was great and cheap. Chinatown is very close and I did not sense any bad neighborhood vibes from it like other reviewers mentioned. If you're aware and careful, any area is safe. I've yet to be robbed once or had a problem my entire life and I've traveled all over the world (knock on wood). The bed was a regular king size bed which was satisfactory. The TV was flat screen and wonderful for my boyfriend (ESPN...) The bathroom was large and the shower curtain rod is rounded so it makes the large tub even bigger. The shower curtain was a bit short though for when you're taking a shower and you put the curtain inside. I did have to go buy bar soap because the one there contained aloe and I'm allergic to it. What I wasn't expecting the most was the cleaning service. They came early (8:30) but since we were there for the conference, it wasn't a problem. They go away if you lock it and don't open the door too. But what I was surprised about was how clean they made everything! The lady even put a face towel under our items on the bathroom counter top. She threw away our empty drinks on the sitting area table too. The linens were always nice and hair free. The lobby area of the hotel was very modern but also very comfortable to sit around it. They had lots of couches and tables. People were always there working away on their laptops or sitting around reading books. Even with people there all the time, there was also always enough seating that you could find a space. I don't know how much more I can praise this place but if I'm coming to Chicago for the conference again next year, I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Glassnut
Reviews.Content: The staff and service were fantastic! My requests were always greeted with a smile. The decor was lovely and relaxing. I love the restaurants. The prices were very reasonable and the amount was more than I could handle. All the rooms have a huge soaking tub! I needed this after my ride with a lead footed cabby. This little gem is a well kept secret.

Reviews.Title: “Great for accrss to trade shows”
Reviews.Author: stortzenheimmer
Reviews.Content: Front desl staff are friendly, rooms are ok but getting old. Bar really rocks on Tuesday night kareoke night if that is your thing. No breakfast except a little sandwich place and don"y bother.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good, location not so good”
Reviews.Author: A.Brouwer
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks good and my room was ok. And yes there are issues regarding noise but I did have a good sleep. But the minor point is the location. Nearest subway stop is a 10-15 minutes walk and there is nothing around the hotel. It is a somewhat deserted area altough chinatown is not very far. There is a bus stop in front of the hotel which is served by #29 with good connection to downtown Chicago and the navy pier. You won't find food shops near the hotel. The hotel has a small shop which sells drinks and snacks but it's quite expensive. There is also a deli in the hotel. Hotel staff was friendly and the lobby looks impressive. My room was spacious and there was even a small fridge. However, one of the lamps didn't work but for me it was not a big deal. A good hotel but you might opt for a hotel in downtown Chicago. I got this hotel thanks to hotwire and I paid 270$ including tax for 3 nights. You won't get this deal for a downtown hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: kawayne41
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near Chicago's Chinatown. I booked the room because of the price, but ended up spending my savings on taxi fare because the hotel is a bit off the beaten path. The closest subway stop is about a 30 minute walk. The room itself was spartan, but comfortable and clean. I found the beds to be very comfortable. The front desk staff are adequate and sufficiently friendly. The area around the hotel is quite bleak. There are no convenient stores or other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A place to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: KODuran
Reviews.Content: I visited Chicago on a budget and decided to stay because the cost. The place makes you feel like you are on a budget, the rooms are very plain. The service was below average. Tried being friendly to the staff but they act emotionless and like they don't like their jobs. It was by no means the worse place I've stayed, but I felt like a cheap skate for staying here. If you are just passing thru this is an okay place, but if you want a Chicago experience, spend a little more and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Bryan C
Reviews.Content: In general, most of staff was courteous and helpful. Door man was not very congenial. Pearl had quite an attitude until she had fixed me some turnip greens also had coffee there every morning and it was good! That kind of broke the ice. Gift shop hours were horrendous!!! Unacceptable! The sports bar was the only hope as far as amenities goes, absolutely helped make this stay here for 9 long nights way more enjoyable! Thanks, Kim,V,Cassandra,Dana and Richard Dent! I want to give a special thanks to Bob Wood and Patrick the maintenance man! They are deserving of a bonus. Renee seemed ok until she saw us conversing with Patrick. Renee passed us and we said Patrick is helping us and then very rudely she replied "I bet he is" No props for Renee!

Reviews.Title: “Had its good points and bad points, but overall: OK”
Reviews.Author: Denise G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very reasonably priced and had free wireless internet, as well as a pretty short walk to the convention center. However, the rooms were pretty drab and there was no room service. The one restaurant did provide takeout, but it took a long time. The staff was very helpful, however, including the folks who helped flag down taxis every day. They did have a "business center" which was a small room with computers, printers and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: reff55
Reviews.Content: Staye here becaus eit was close to McCormick Place attending a convention. Rooms were clean, food was average. Service terrible, took 60 minute to get breakfast. The beds are hard, people rude almost to where they don't care. Everybody is slowwww here. Stay at a Howard Johnson, Best Western, etc. You can't walk any where because of the area. Train goes buy every 15 minutes so bring ear plugs and valiam to get to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “You get little more than you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: AnteBante
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not a central location, however it is about 15 minutes with bus or 10 minutes with taxi / car to the city centre. The busstop is right outside the hotel, and taxi garage is 200 meters away - so no problem. If you drive you can park for free, however parking in central Chicago is NOT FREE - better to take a taxi or bus. The hotel was clean, very spacious room and alert personell. We did not try the restaurants in the hotel and the breakfast opened to late, but they looked a little booring. It is about 7 minutes walk to nearest Burger King / McDonalds - not much around the hotel. But very easy to access from the interstate and from the city centre. Also - the woman-manager (as it Rachel) was very nice to us and let us stay 2 extra hours allowing us to shower before heading back home after the Chicago Marathon. VERY NICE and HELPFUL - thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the center, at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: dannythyboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights, I am a solo traveler. The room and the bathroom were really big and for the price it was a very good deal, cause the area is close enough to the center: bus 29 brings you downtown in 15-20 minutes and stops right in front of the hotel. The Chinatown metro red line station is also only a 10 minute walk away, so that you can easily get anywhere with public transportation. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel bar is lively and fills with non-residents for the Cubs and Bears matches: I really recommend to stop by if in town on match-day. The only minus is that the area is sort of deserted and slightly intimidating, at least at first, and - while I didn't have any problem whatsoever - I didn't feel comfortable walking around at night. But it might have been only my imagination :)!

Reviews.Title: “Good Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: peace44881
Reviews.Content: For the past 5 years, I've been staying at the South Loop Hotel. It's convenient, good customer service, lovely rooms and much more. I was a guest of other major hotels in Chicago, but since I was introduce to the South Loop, I tell everyone whose traveling to Chicago, to try the South Loop Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Price was right, room was huge, felt very safe”
Reviews.Author: kathy728
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed there for one night. Huge room. They do not have roll aways, but our little guy slept well on the sofa in the room. Two queen beds, huge tub and shower, very clean, fridge, coffee maker. I was very satisfied. We actually walked 2 miles from the hotel to the Field Museum around 11 am and felt very safe. We took a cab back from downtown that night and it cost about $14. Our car was parked in their secure lot without incident. Free parking is a major PLUS to this place. There is a restaurant/bar (maybe 2) attached to the hotel. I poked my head in and they looked fine. Also had a gift shop and a little store for coffee, bagels, etc. Free wifi business center, fitness center. I looked everywhere for a reasonable room rate and a hotel that would let us book for one weekend night only because that was all we needed. The only reason I did not give it five stars is that it was a little noisy. We were on the second floor overlooking the street so when someone's car alarm went off at midnight, we heard it and when a cabbie got in a argument at 7 am with someone we heard that too. Overall though I consider these minor inconvenieces and would definitely recommend this place for the budget conscious traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to convention center.”
Reviews.Author: Jaycoakley
Reviews.Content: This is a great value. Nice hotel, clean and close to convention center. Free parking that is gated.

Reviews.Title: “From the Treasure family”
Reviews.Author: Amanda T
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful time at the chicago south loop hotel. The rooms were spotless the service was wonderful. the staff was exceptional very helpfull and nice going above and beyond there dutys from the front desk to housekeeping. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Chicago. Special thanks to Bernita, Monique, Jackie, Kevin, Byron, Taron, Renee, Jim, Diane w and if I missed anyone I came in contact with who works at the hotel special thanks to you all also. To the management you have a great crew that works for you treat them with the upmost respect because I hope to see them all on our next trip to chicago and we plan on coming to stay at the south loop hotel! Sincerely Mr. & Mrs. Treasure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with an attitude”
Reviews.Author: IggyL
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying I never write reviews because other people have done it, BUT, this hotel has been such an odd stay that I had to put it in writing. The hotel itself is fine...the room is surprisingly large (although I did get a wheelchair accesible room for some reason, and these are usually quite larger). The bed is fine, but the blankets are almost see-through. The elevator is slow, but with only 5 floors its not a huge deal. The staff...the staff is atrocious. The front desk has been manned by some rather snappy women with bad attitudes. Asking for where the parking is and asking for some clarification got me a very bad, unnecessary snappy answer. The cafe (Awake with Pearl) has a gigantic poster of "The Black Person in the Workplace" full of semi-activist pro-black remarks, and generally insinuating all black people are mistreated by white people in the workplace. I won't debate whether this is true or not here, but does it REALLY have to be in the wall of a hotel cafe? Is that the ambiance we're going for here? The lady at the register also has her attitude well up front, and generally made us feel extremely unwelcome. The latest and greatest was finding the convenience/gift shop still closed at 5pm and when I asked at what time it was meant to open I got "Whenever she feels like is...there's no set time" Un-freaking-believable. Now, I have absolutely no problems in hotels. I spend 95% of my year in hotels, I'm very polite and educated and I know how things work, especially with my brother being a major hotel manager. This attitude is inexcusable.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago's best kept Secret.”
Reviews.Author: William M
Reviews.Content: The Professional Motorcoach operators of Transportation Unlimited from Dallas,Texas stay here everytime we come to Chicago.The staff are always helpful and pleasant.I want to give my boy Victor and Ms.Jackie praise for always making us feel @ home,they should be commended for a great job.We would not stay anywhere else,great place and awesome staff, not to mention the great rooms and the people who take care of the rooms while we are their. William Mathis,Dallas,Tx

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, but a very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: marybink
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights while in Chicago for a conference at the Chicago Hilton. This hotel was only 2 miles away and considerable cheaper than the rooms at the Hilton. While very close to downtown, the South Loop Hotel is in an area that is still revitalizing. So there's not much directly around the hotel, but there is a bus stop across the street that takes you right into downtown on State Street. The hotel is also walking distance from Chinatown, but I'd be a bit cautious about walking this distance alone or at night. Despite having to take the bus into downtown, the hotel was very nice. The rooms are spacious with a flat screen TV and a nice bathroom with better than your standard bath tiles and flooring. The lobby was quite nice and the staff was very friendly. One of the best things about this hotel making it an extraordinary deal is the free parking. Free parking this close to downtown Chicago is unheard of! There were only 3 bad points in my stay. The AC did not work very well, but the temperatures during my stay did not warrant blasting the AC so I was still confortable. On my last morning there, the hot water did not work, so no shower for me. Also, the maid service was a bit lax in the bathroom. There was a smudge from some moisterizer that I accidently dropped on the counter my first day in the room and it stayed there during my entire stay. Clearly no one was wiping down the bathroom sink and counter. However, I can't complain to much because, let's face it, I don't wash my bathroom counter every day at home. Would definitely stay here again. It's quite a convenient location for Soldier Field and not too far from downtown. If you are willing to take the bus, it's very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Who's your Daddy ...”
Reviews.Author: Lars V
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just south of Downtown Chicago and very accessible from the freeways. Cab ride to Chicago hot spots etc. is only $8-10 each way. Rooms are nice, big and comfortable and as a business traveler they offer free internet and room to work. The service we received from the front desk was excellent. Evelyn was out evening/night concierge and she gave excellent restaurant suggestions and even ordered for us (didn't pay but that is OK ;-)

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NelsonTouch7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into this hotel upon our arrival directly from the airport and stayed for three nights before setting out on a road trip. One definite reason I picked this hotel was because the car parking is free and the car parks (2 of them) were behind very secure steel railings and surveillance cameras covered them 24/7. There is no 'valet' parking. We were checked in by Bob at the reception desk. He was very efficiant and answered our questions with patience and he was very helpful, he gave us a guide book with maps of the buses and EL routes and also told us there were bus stops on State Street just outside the hotel. He said the best transport option for a visitor could be a CTA pass, and he was right too, as this allowed us to hop on and off any bus or EL train for about $14 bucks instead of $2.25 for EVERY trip, whenever you got on again, which meant the CTA ticket paid for itself several times over as we were doing a lot of hopping on and off the public transport system. We got the 3 day pass (you can get 1 day, 3 day or 1 week or longer if needed) from the counter at the Walgreen's store, right where the bus stops at the corner of E.Roosevelt St and State St. There is also a Red Line EL station there and that gets you onto the Chicago EL system using the same ticket all the way, it's great! We quietly thanked Bob many times for telling us about that, it saved us money as car parking charges in downtown Chicago is just horrendous. The room was very good, very clean and fresh and there was plenty of space. There was no coffee maker in the room but we were told by a lady at the desk (who I think was the duty manager) that new ones had just arrived and would be put in the rooms shortly. In the meantime there was a coffee maker in the Business Centre, which was well equipped with several computers and a printer. The bar was busy and there was plenty of seating. The restaurant is clean and roomy and the food is very good. After our road trip through 5 States, we returned to this hotel for our last night before flying home, we had arranged this beforehand with a lady on the front desk. Bob was again on duty and we discovered that our room had been reserved for the wrong date. It looked like we were going to have to find somewhere else instead as the hotel was filling up, which I noticed from the amount of cars in the car park. Bob saved the day and did some juggling around on his computer and he got us booked in after all, with no fuss or bother at all with an upgrade! He remembered us from 2 weeks before and greeted us by name, I was impressed. Just what I like, the whole thing ran as if on rails. Every hotel should have a Bob! And the coffee maker was in the room too! We intend to use this hotel next year when we come over again to drive down Route 66.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad location.”
Reviews.Author: robertowolf
Reviews.Content: The hotel by itself was okay. Service was fine but seemed like the staff wasn't willing to go the extra mile for attention. No one helped with the bunch of luggage I was carrying. Best thing was the room. Very clean and spacious and the free parking. Worst thing is the neighborhood where the hotel is located and their key system seemed to be not working. During the 3 days I stayed, both my keys stopped working repeatedly and had to be redone. I don't think I'd be coming back to this hotel any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is okay except....”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl140
Reviews.Content: 1 - The staff is a little too sociable upon check in. There were at least 10 people in line waiting to be checked into their room and the staff somewhat lagged in that area. They talked to each other about non work related issues, talked with other hotel employees, and to other guests staying in the hotel. We were in line for at least 20 minutes trying to get our room. 2- They checked us into a room that wasn't clean. The rooms are a decent size (plus there), but to be checked into a room with the covers all over the floor and other things in disarray was not a good thing. We should have known better when we overheard them saying that they checked someone else into a room that was occupied as well (before we checked in). They quickly rectified it by switching our room and upgrading us. 3- The restaurant, while the ambiance was nice, left a bit to be desired. They list their hours as opening at 5:00 pm for dinner but at around 5:15 after seeing a few employees standing around and the door being locked we knocked on the door and asked what was going on. They "forgot to unlock the doors." Stay away from the onion soup, was not good AT ALL, but the scallops and rissoto were actually pretty good. If you're on a budget and need a decent place to stay then by all means stay here. But for what you will spend in cab rides and food (because there is nothing good in the immediate area) you might as well stay closer to where everything is.

Reviews.Title: “We love it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Ann T
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at the Chicago South Loop Hotel. We love it and plan to return. The rooms are nice, the hospitality is wondeful and the prices are quite reasonable. Jackie (front desk) is awesome! She alone can make the stay wonderful because she goes out of her way to make sure guests are comfortable. Thank you for another pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “An "above and beyond" staff!”
Reviews.Author: Calvin M
Reviews.Content: You might put a price on a hotel room with all the amenities, but you can't put a price on the value of excellent staff who go above and beyond in the performance of their duties. If you come here, then hope to have Yvonne, Betty, Cheryl, Anabel, Jieling or Bernita caring for your hotel room and housekeeping needs. I love the little personal business cards each one signs and leaves behind her in our room; both the signature and the message are worth keeping. Questions, concerns----even keeping up with our personal mail sent to us here at the hotel----are handled with professional courtesy and great smiles, along with words of encouragement and kindness by front desk staff Kierra, Evelyn, Jackie and Regina. I've never stayed in a motel or hotel, cheap as well as expensive, where the front desk cared about my day and how they could help to make it better. Whether it was Yvonne, Evelyn and Kierra's get-well card to our son in the hospital or Regina's coming to our rescue when we needed a last-minute extension on our room so we could stay here longer, we will always remember the Chicago South Loop Hotel as the best possible place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and we will return”
Reviews.Author: TiaOhio
Reviews.Content: I checked in to the Hotel with my 10 year old daughter and I have to say that the customer service which I was given from Regina was OUTSTANDING! She was very pleasent from our initial point of contact with her. We arrived to the hotel before check-in time and wasn't quite sure if we would be able to get our room so early, but Regina was able to work her fingers and get us in. Thanks so much Regina. Keep up the good work. After meeting her, my daughter and I were also able to speak with the Kiera and Renee who were also very pleasant and very nice. Thank you for exceptioanl customer service ladies. From the point we entered the lobby of the hotel, to our room, to the parking lot, the premises were immaculate. Our room was very room and smelled very fresh. Love it! I can not say of anything I do not like about the hotel. I will definitely stay again as well as recommend this hotel to others who may be traveling to the area. Thanks for the beautiful stay Chicago South Loop Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Room, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: WDemaree
Reviews.Content: An altogether great experience. Keira called the room after check-in to be sure all was ok; she was pleasant when I had a question about the bill. The room was comfortable and quiet, even with the El just across the way. Highly recommended. (And free parking!)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Mischa L
Reviews.Content: Kierra, Irma and Patrick were all helpful and attentive during our family's stay. Helping us and making us comfortable while we attended a family funeral.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: coop921
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the location and price when considering the value offered. The staff (Kierra & Zerina) was very helpful and gracious. I would highly recommend you consider them on your next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever want to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: electric39
Reviews.Content: My company and i have been at the south loop hotel for a few weeks now and during my experience here I have been locked out of my room on a daily occurance which I dealt with at first then it had gotten out of hand when hours have gone by without us getting into our room. The hotel staff tried bribing us with free pizza for the inconvienance and a great review of there staff and security but the facts show that this hotel is one to stay away from there service and hospitality are the of the most ignorance that I have ever seen traveling with the government of the united states of America. During my stay here I've been bribed by the hotel staff and security, I've been locked out of my room on a daily occurance for hours, the hotel is infested with spiders and cockroaces which I had founded out during the last several days here. The motels staff was switching our rooms but no matter what room you stay in there is a problem with each such as the locks dont work or the air conditioning doesn't work or the room is infestested with spiders, the hotel is also infested with hookers. I had never been more humiliated during my stay here with the hotel staff trying to set me up with prostitutes. I was impelled by the motion of this staff at the south loop hotel in chicago,Il.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: barrythewombat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in May and had a very nice time. As the name says, it's located in the South Loop area, very close to the bus lines which will take you anywhere you want to go. (It's also just about the only hotel downtown that offers free parking.) The room was quite large, with two big beds and a separate area for a sitting room. The staff was very helpful and many good restaurants deliver. I would definitely stay there again if I find myself back in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Pleasantly Surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: HugeHabsFan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire for our family of four and our friends (a family of 3) for a 4 night, 5 day stay in Chicago for sight seeing and shopping. We knew it was a short distance out of the downtown, but being that we were planning on hitting the museum campus and as well the MSI which is even a bit further south, it seemed to be a logical location to stay. Well, it was better than we had even hoped for. The hotel is located on the corner of Staed and W. 26th, with the bus stop directly across the street. If you take the 29 straight up State, you can easily get off at Roosevelt and walk into the Museum Campus, or get off further north near Van Buren and walk a few blocks to the Sears Tower and the 29 even goes straight to Navy Pier too! We decided to just drive the short distance to the MSI. State street has great shopping, and if you take the 29 up to Lake St, you can walk two blocks east and enjoy the Magnificent Mile! This hotel was very clean, our room was HUGE (be sure to ask if you can get a corner room) and if you ask to be on a higher floor with a north view you can see the city! Free parking & free wi-fi in Chicago?? Basically unheard of! Evelyn at the front desk was just wonderful. She provided us with tons of tips and ideas, helped us decide what we were doing for transportation for the MSI and enjoyed chatting with us in general. That being said, the ladies at the desk when we checked in were less than enthusiastic (the lady's name eludes me at the moment, but it started with a "Z"), but Evelyn more than made up for any disappointment there. Also, I noticed another review that mentioned noise levels - we were there four nights and never heard a thing. It was quiet as can be! We will absolutely stay here again and have already recommended it to several friends who have or are heading to Chicago for a few days. The only thing that would be nice would maybe be a better (read more reasonably priced) restaurant for breakfast in the hotel. Other than that I really can't come up with any negatives!

Reviews.Title: “Stranded du 2 hurricane :)”
Reviews.Author: Gloucesterfisherman
Reviews.Content: Thank u, Regina,Kierra,Kevin& Monique for making my stay so stress free and understanding that due to the weather that people get stuck and it puts a strain on there original travel plans You folks made it painless for me to adjust the room rate du to an act of god. Plus everyone is so friendly including the guest Thank u......tha fisherman

Reviews.Title: “Regina turned my day around...”
Reviews.Author: spfldok
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Chicago South Loop Hotel from Amtrak's Chicago Union Station not knowing what to expect. I had just gotten finished fighting with Amtrak about what to do when my connecting train from Chicago to Glenwood Springs, Colorado had been cancelled. Passenger Services at the station was a horror show, but they did offer to provide me with a complimentary night's hotel stay. Tired and weary from the previous day's train trip from Springfield, Massachusetts, (and now sure when I would be able to leave Chicago), I was ready for a rest. Regina greeted me at the front desk and my mood changed immediately. Her genuine concern for my situation and her ability to meet my needs, along with answering my questions, made my feel right welcome. Had a great night and was ready the next day to continue my journey. Thanks Regina!

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasantly surprised and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: We had excellent service at the front desk. Kierra & Zerina went out of their way to assist us with a mix up in the reservations & helped us get a reservation at an excellent restaurant. It was great to interface with to ladies with such great attitudes and willingness to go beyond whatwas expected. They were a great first Impression for the hotel. The rooms were very clean and well serviced. The only negative was our limited choices for breakfast & dinner & an unfriendly bar.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: PJack1368
Reviews.Content: This is a low budget hotel with the feel of a high budget hotel when you walk into the lobby. Seems like a popular place for family reunions so you can imagine children, visitors, loud talking, drinking....more than what I bargained for. The decor is very 70's. Large rooms, small flat screen, basic furniture, poor decorations, no amenities. There is nothing in walking distance to go to: not a store, restaurant, gas station, NOTHING. Pass on this one definitely.

Reviews.Title: “my stay was great”
Reviews.Author: rick d
Reviews.Content: my three day stay was great, but was even better when regina at the front desk went the extra mile to help me with my boarding pass. thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Would TOTALLY stay at this hotel again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: So_Cali_Girl_LA
Reviews.Content: Things feel apart the day before my trip and i booked my room through Expedia unpublished deals and got this hotel. At first I was disappointed because of the reviews. I was TOTALLY shocked when I arrived at the hotel. I thought to myself WTF??? The hotel was clean, well lit and the employees were very helpful. The pictures does not do the hotel any justice. BEWARE of the reviews!!!!! The first person I met was KIERRA and she was AMAZING!!! All the employees were all AMAZING, especially KIERRA, EVELYN, MONIQUE, TARON, YVONNE, REGINA, JACKIE, DAVID. I stayed at the Chicago South Loop Hotel for a week (7/11-7/17) and had a great experience. The hotel had free parking and free wi-fi. Parking is not cheap in this city. I would totally stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: Sandra P
Reviews.Content: My family had a reunion at Chicago South Loop Hotel on 8/17/2011 - 8/21/20011. I was very impressed with the high level of professionalism and courtesy of the staff. The lobby was beautiful and well maintained. I was a little disappointed with the room because it was a bit outdated, but when I saw the jacuzzi sized bathtub, I was completely won over. By the third day there, the room appeared old world charming. I appreciated the cleanliness of the room and I want to thank Cheryl and Diane for making me feel pampered. Special thanks to Regina and the other ladies at the front desk who answered all of my questions about the hotel and surrounding area. I will definitely stay at this hotel the next time I visit Chicago. Keep up the good work - excellent if you had a pool, but the fitness center and all the other amenities that you look for in a hotel will keep customers coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Jackie Washington”
Reviews.Author: b b
Reviews.Content: I had made a reservation for my brother in-law who was not able to keep the reservation and I cancelled it a month before his arrival. But my credit card was charge for two days. I contacted Jackie Washington at Chicago South Loop Hotel and requested a refund. She was very pleasant and professional and she helped me with the refund. Thank you Jackie for a professional and courteous service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel w/great service”
Reviews.Author: muzzee
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at the hotel. Very nice with very large rooms. I had a couple of issues I needed help with and Regina (front desk) helped me... and, she was awesome - very professional and very helpful! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great service by the front desk”
Reviews.Author: 17Neil
Reviews.Content: I was serviced by Jackie Washingtonn at the front desk. She went out of her way to help me on a few occaisions and was very impressed. The overall service was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Emprbasist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights while we were visiting Chicago. We wanted to stay near downtown for the touristy things like the Navy Pier and Millenium Park, but I hated the idea of staying at a hotel that charges an arm and leg for parking. This hotel offers free parking and within a very short cab ride to most of the attractions of downtown Chicago. The hotel itself is decent, it isn't a 5 star hotel but I thought it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it and will return soon!!”
Reviews.Author: Leeanna Y
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time. Regina checked us in and helped us get an upgraded room with no extra charge. We were not far from the city. The staff were extremely helpful when we asked for assistance to get around town, they gave us coupons for restaurants nearby and made sure we could find our way around. The beds were not very comfortable but the pillows made up for it!! The rooms are a little outdated but very cozy. My husband and I had a great stay and hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Attitude Adjustment!!!”
Reviews.Author: B Joe H
Reviews.Content: Absolutely Awesome Hotel! I had the pleasure at staying at this hotel on short notice. The Staff, specifically Ms. Jackie, and Ms. Regina provided great service. I flew in from Washington, D.C. and my family failed to find a place for me to stay. CSLH found a way to help me at the most difficult time. Once I got to my room, everything was well laid out, the room was very clean, and you the climate, as well as the freshness of the room was very nice. The Attitude of every member of the staff was very friendly and professional. I will certainly comeback to this hotel!! You cant beat the price! This is where you want to sleep tonight...Trust me!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Regina!!! Yes, I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: kylecoffee
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic weekend and huge thanks go to Regina at the front desk! Wow! She got me in my room before noon on my check-in day and helped with directions and local attractions. She went out of her way to make my stay fantastic!!! This is an outstanding hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow....this is the kind of service you expect from a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MissOakland
Reviews.Content: From Check-In to Check-Out, the service I received was great! If you are lucky enough to get Miss Jacqueline or Regina providing service at the front desk, you will be happy!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was fine and the staff was exceptional - especially Jackie and Regina”
Reviews.Author: Anthony B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the South Loop Hotel for the IBS Conference and they were able to accommodate me for a last minute meeting in the McKormick room with great ease. I am returning to Chicago in two weeks and have already book my room at your fine establishment. Tony Browder

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bruce H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the South Loop Hotel several times on past business trips. This is an excellent hotel near the downtown area and restaurants. They have large rooms compared to other hotels in the area, given the choice I'll always choose their hotel over several others in the downtown area. Bruce

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Ifakolade O
Reviews.Content: After driving around for hours, and even with a disturbance in the main fouyer, my guest and i found the night manager Steve to be quite helpful and courteous. We would recomend all our guest consider this hotel as an option when staying in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Evelyn Yee is a great staff there.”
Reviews.Author: CTwasabi
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are amazingly spacious, with two queen size beds, a small sitting area and a mini fridge. We were still able to fit a play pen in between two beds off our toddler son. The bathroom was roomy enough to fit a family of four in it. Evelyn was very helpful at the front desk - great recommendations with the local eats and attractions. We loved the fact that the hotel parking lot was fenced in. We felt very safe inside the hotel premises. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “not a boutique hotel, but accomplished the purpose of our trip”
Reviews.Author: intecorpuk
Reviews.Content: My main purpose of picking this hotel because it have 2 double beds so me and my friend don't have to share a bed. Also this hotel provides free wi-fi in the room and around the hotel, most other Downtown hotel you would have to pay for it. I have actually done some research prior to booking, so I kinda know what to experience, most of the reviews are generally okay. I was told by my friend this hotel had a complete revamped, torn down and rebuilt, where as they won't recommend anyone to stay before. The hotel is clean and tidy, and appears to have a steady stream of conference business. Free car parking for those who choose to drive, but parking space are on a first come first serve, and most places in Chicago have parking meters even on a Sunday!! On check-in 15 minutes before the official check-in time, the lady at the desk seems a bit overwhelmed, and asked us to wait, because one of her colleague went for her lunch break, and she had 5 phone calls on hold. After waiting for 10 minutes she eventually managed to check us into the hotel. She was very pleasant and told us how to get to our room. We found the room spacious; it has LCD TV and a refrigerator, good size bathroom and generally cleans. There are lots of area that the hotel could do better for example there was no mention of any of its facilities and amenities at check-in. No in-room service directory. There is a takeaway menu as their room service menu, it is a pizza place about a mile away on S Archer and you have to call and they deliver. There is a bar in the hotel, not sure if its sub-contracted or not, but it seems to serve lunch and dinner. There is a gift shop but it was always closed for the 6 nights we were there. There is a fitness centre we have called the front desk and they told us it opens 24 hours. There is also a coffee shop / cafÃ© that double up as a place you can buy breakfast/lunch/late snack. I wish they would have told us about this coffee shop, we would have went there instead going outside the hotel to starbucks a few bus stop away. There is also a business centre with free internet and printing. There is a coffee/tea machine, but I wouldnâ€™t recommend it, it tasted like sewage water. Overall, a very nice hotel competitive pricing on hotels.com with good public transport to the downtown area. We choose this location because we been to Chicago loads of times before, and would prefer a spacious room. For those who has never been to Chicago before, and does not need a parking space. Perhaps a hotel in downtown area would be a better option. But for us this hotel accomplished the purpose of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Evelyn Yee is the greastest!”
Reviews.Author: Ceceli
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms, exceptional service, great location and a quality price. The rooms were very modern and clean. I loved everything about my stay. I liked the views and the staff was great. Evelyn Yee was our contact and she was excellent. Very friendly and made us feel at home. We will definitely be recommending the South Loop to our friends and plan on coming back ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Chi oh my!”
Reviews.Author: DaveLandes
Reviews.Content: Just one mile from Cellular Field (White Sox). Free parking! Rooms were better than adequate. The staff was very kind and helpful, especially one young lady by the name of Kierra. She helped me through a problem with a violation I had made with I-Pass, due to my unfamiliarity with Chicago's freeway toll system. She took care of everything for me on-line at the front desk. I was not even aware that violators had 7 days to pay unpaid toll fees, rather than later having to pay a much higher violation charge. Thank you Kierra. And God bless and cheers to the Chicago South Loop Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Free parking”
Reviews.Author: An_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: The only pro for this hotel was the free parking part. We parked our car and took the bus for travelling around. Its not very far from the famous "Miracle Mile". I did not like walking from the bus stop to the hotel at all, even at day time.The hotel has a great lobby, but the charm of the hotel kind of ends there.The rooms were just ok. We had the back parking lot view from our room- so you can take it as no view. We did not have a central ac but a window one, which is fine. The bed as such was good, I had a good night sleep. The blanket was dirty and I never used it. The bathroom was fine, the shower horrible. Towels were neat. They can order pizza for you from the hotel, we never had that. Chicago is filled with amazing places to eat, why eat hotel pizza? The front desk staff were very amiable. We booked it through priceline and it was good for the price. I am not sure about internet connection though. All in all if you are in a group filled with fun people and plan to just get in to sleep and park your car then this hotel really suits you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: KathyDonelan
Reviews.Content: Hotel had very nice rooms and a fridge which was an added plus. BUT no coffee maker! So every morning I was there I went to Awake wtih Pearl Coffee Shop to get my coffee. The best part of the trip was a helpful staff member. I had asked Ron for some directions and neighborhood safety. He provided me with great directions and which neighborhoods to stay out of. He also provided me with his phone number just in case we got lost! Talk about service! In all my years of traveling I have to say this was the first time a staff member gave me a phone number if needed in case we needed help! I was very impressed! I have told everyone about it when we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and free parking”
Reviews.Author: jrw05
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was very helpful and friendly. Easy access to public transportation to get to downtown and museum campus. The rooms were clean and the free parking was a bonus. It is expensive to park your car at a hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - not a great location”
Reviews.Author: SCTraveler69
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and helpful. You could not ask for better. The price is very reasonable, and they don't charge extra for internet or refrigerators in the room. (Why do expensive hotels charge for these things - aren't they making enough!) Also, plenty of free parking. Rooms were spacious and, while not fancy, were fine and comfortable. Nice little business center, too. Unfortunately, it is far away from just about everything. The closest restaurant is about 1/2 mile (and not very exciting). The closest grocery is miles. It's about a 15-20 minute cab to downtown, or a 30 minute bus. So, you save money, but if you're wanting to "experience" Chicago, you'll need to allocate time to get to the main attractions. And, if you're like me, and you sometimes want to go out, then come back before going out for the night, that doubles the travel time needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: chick52
Reviews.Content: the service and location was great! Check in was smooth,especially since I understand there were 2or 3 family reunions, a bday party and a wedding reception ,all during my weekend stay. Checkout was Great and uneventful with the help of Ms. Regina. The only thing I missed at this hotel was a swimming pool. Thanks for hosting our family reunion.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convient, very affordable”
Reviews.Author: redhotgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convient to IIT campus. We checked in with Monique who was very cheerful in helping with directions and restaurant recommendations. After a smooth check in Kevin helped with our luggage. He had much to talk about regarding the city and his favorite restaurant as well. All in all this hotel is great and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: edlisa
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price, and includes free parking in well lit lot, which is hard to find in a Chicago hotel. The larger rooms were very nice and beds were very comfortable. A small sitting area with table is a nice addition as well. We also had refrigerators in the rooms, although not listed as amenities on their website. You may want to avoid rooms directly over the restaurant/bar area as late night music (which you have to pay a cover charge to get into) can be a problem if you are a light sleeper. Staff was very friendly, especially Kevin, who gave us good tips on transportation, food and attractions in the area. Not in downtown loop, but bus does stop right outside hotel that provides transportation all the way up to Navy Pier and other CTA rail terminals. Hotel also includes restaurant, bar, snack bar, business center, gift shop and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, the Best staff ever.”
Reviews.Author: Terika
Reviews.Content: It was a great choice for the family and friends of a couple getting married in Chicago. Beautiful Hotel. The rooms were comfortable and had plenty of space. When we checked in we were greeted by a pleasant woman named Renee. She was very helpful in getting us registered and settled in our room. Over the following days we were helped by the concierge Evelyn Yee. She not only gave us good suggestions, maintained available if we needed to reach her, but even came to get us when we were stranded. We were unable to find a cab after dinner and one phone call to her and she was there to help. Throughout the stay she checked in with us and even emailed us after our stay. Every employee we came in contact were pleasant and courteous. Employees like these have made this hotel top of our list when we return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: shorty2389
Reviews.Content: It's surprising how some people could display total and absolute professionalism in their chosen career. I have traveled a lot across the United States and rarely meet perfect hotel attendants and associates whose services meet not only my expectation but a model worthy of emulation. I met Jacqueline of Chicago South Loop Hotel on Thursday morning and her courteous interraction, decent language and professional approach to duty since is so inspiring that Chicago South Loop Hotel will forever remain my chosen home away from home. Jacqueline is a wonderful and phenominal associate of this hotel. It is my fervent hope and wish that her stewardship will go a long way into full recognition not only by the management and staff of this hotel but from all and sundry that comes close to her. While congratulating Jacqueline for her exceptional services would urge her to remain blessed in the Lord !!!

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: sq041906
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exceptionally clean and the staff was friendly and attentive. Kevin, Evelyn and Monique were more than helpful with all our needs. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room great, staff better!”
Reviews.Author: Murdochsmom
Reviews.Content: Our room was well furnished & very clean. The beds were comfortable. Bathrooms are large enough to allow changing of clothes. I would gladly stay here again for the value alone, but the staff went above &beyond to ensure our comfort. The desk clerk, Kierra cheerfully answered our questions & gave us wonderful suggestions. Her supervisor, Renee was exceptionally kind & helpful. Our bellman, Kevin Rowe, went so far as to pick up a special newspaper for me on his way into work. The convent location, the bus to downtown stops across the street, & clean rooms ensure our return stay, and the staff makes it an even greater pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, Helpful and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Cogit8tor
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the other TripAdvisor reviewers who recommended this hotel. We found it a clean, convenient and affordable place to stay in Chicago and a great base of operations for exploring attractions in the Loop and Navy Pier. The front desk told me the hotel was built three years ago on redeveloped land that had once been "projects" and the area around the property is clearly gentrifying. I never felt unsafe, but was very glad that parking for guests was secured by a key-card accessed gate and tall fence. We appreciated that the hotel was right on 26th and State Streets so that we could catch the #29 CTA bus to the Loop and later take the same bus back from Navy Pier in the evening. The night bellhop (Damien?) was quite helpful in recommending places where I could get $5.75 CTA one-day "fun passes" for the busses and ELs when I got in. Best bet for those -- a 24-hour Walgreens drugstore at Rooseveldt and Canal Streets. There are refrigerators--but not freezers--in each room, I think. Wireless access was good. All in all, a safe and wise choice for a budget-minded traveler. The only downside was that our queen bed was a bit too soft so my wife and I ended up sliding into the center of the bed instead of having support on each side. A little extra togetherness wasn't hard to put up with, though.

Reviews.Title: “Not Real Happy”
Reviews.Author: want2travel3787
Reviews.Content: I was a bit unsatisfied with my stay at the South Loop Hotel in Chicago. I went there knowing it was a bit far from The Magnificent Mile and pretty close to the convention center which was great. My first complaint, very uncomfortable beds. I have been spoiled in other hotels I guess but these were pretty hard. The room was pretty clean and like other reviews mentioned the bath tub was very big and clean. The location was a not what I expected as in not in a real good area. I knew we were close to China Town but I was not going to venture out to find it. My husband and I took a cab to the convention center, and when we took a cab home the driver for 20 years in that area had no idea what Hotel we were talking about. We gave him the cross streets and he said "oh that's right. I heard they built a hotel where the projects used to be" Now lets talk about the food. They had a restaurant, a bar with food and a small cafe for breakfast. The dinner in the hotel was very overpriced with really bad service and the food was not great. the next night we decided to try the bar, what we did not know was the food came form the restaurant we ate dinner at the night before. the food was still bad. The bar tender was great though, thumbs up. The price we paid for the Hotel was good, but I would not have expected to pay much more based on the location. I am not sure I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was worth the one night stay, I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: HondaMamma
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exceptional friendly and clean. The staff, especially Victor and Regina, were very helpful and pleasant. They greeted you with a great attitude and willingness to be "at your service". I love the location as it is close to my friends/familly as well as close to Downtown. The bar is a treat, where I can meet friends and family and have a great time without leaving the hotel. The rooms are clean, updated and very comfortable. I feel safe and most importantly I am able to get a good night sleep without distractions or annoying noises.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful trip and were thrilled with the hotel and its night staff!”
Reviews.Author: dukett11
Reviews.Content: The night staff was extremely helpful! We checked in with Evelyn and Kierra each night of our stay to plan and get routes for our next days adventures! They were wonderful, gave helpful hints and tips to make our daytrips much easier and enjoyable with our kids! THe day staff was not friendly but the night staff made up for them! Our first evening back to the hotel our door would not let us in and Yvonne stayed with us in the hallway until Ronald the maintenance guy came to our rescue and fixed our door so that we did not have to move from our spectacular corner room! Yvonne and Ronald were so caring and took into account that we had small children with us and worked quickly to solve our door problem and get us inside!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissJC84
Reviews.Content: GOOD MORNING, One person was outstanding in solving a credit card error. That person is KIERRA, she was so very understanding, professional, caring and calm. The problem was solved without any extra stress. On the other hand one other person was NOT at all caring or understanding , She caused plenty unnecessary stress on myself and family members that were registered at the hotel . Thank God for Kierra . Hope I never have to come in contact with that other person again . Overall the stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - great service.”
Reviews.Author: PromoBird
Reviews.Content: I love the South Loop Hotel. For the money, you can't beat it. Free parking. Free WiFi. Regina was very helpful at the front desk. Convenient to McCormick Place. The #29 bus runs right to the front door and can take you to the Loop in minutes for $2.00. Even the vending machines are a value ($1.00 soda).

Reviews.Title: “Made guests feel warm and welcomed!”
Reviews.Author: rosietam
Reviews.Content: For my wedding, my mother and sister had reviewed a few hotels around the city due to convenience and location. They remembered the newly built hotel south of our house so they decided to make a mini trip to check out the rooms/location/etc. They were allowed to see the spacious hotel room and was quoted a reasonable price. I called the hotel a month later to block a few rooms for family and friends traveling in for my wedding. The process was hassle-free and Sheila was very friendly and easy to work with. This was one thing off my list of to-do's which I thought would've been frustrating as many city hotels do not provide free parking, which was a HUGE plus for choosing this hotel. In addition to late responses and late bookings, Evelyn was a GREAT help with the group booking and all my last minute must-needed-room travelers. As days got closer to the wedding, my guests slowly arrived into the city. I checked-in many of my guests and many were hassle-free. For those that checked-in themselves, they all told me how great and friendly Evelyn was at the front desk. That truly made many of my out-of-town guests feel warm and welcomed into the city! (Thanks Evelyn!!!) The front desk was able to provide recommendations of places to eat/places to see/places to go as this was their first time in the city. Another PLUS! Due to the many guests in town, I had to provide some directions (in case they forgot) and Evelyn offered to distribute the directions to the appropriate guests for me. Again, something that literally made a hectic bride-to-be calmer. After the wedding, as my guests had all checked-out and left, I called the hotel and again, Evelyn helped and provided me with my detailed receipts as I picked up the bill for some close relatives. I was just happy overall with the ease of anything involving the hotel and especially how a staff member had made my in-laws feel welcomed into the city (Many of them are afraid of the "big, bad city"!!!). Thank you again!

Reviews.Title: “we had a great stay, everything was good. we will be back!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissKim80
Reviews.Content: I think that the hotel should invest in a microwave and coffee maker i every room.

Reviews.Title: “Value was Consistent with the Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: soulsistah79
Reviews.Content: My friends and I found and reserved Chicago south Loop Hotel as part of a weekend getaway. We were all impressed that the hotel offered free on-site parking and was situated where we could easily access public transportation. Additionally, we found cost of the hotel to be budget-friendly leaving us with more spending money than would other downtown Chicago hotels. The lobby was nicely decorated with Jazz Age paintings and music in the background. The hotel was equipped with a salon, store, gift shop, restaurant and bar. Chicago South Loop has potential for being a premiere hotel in the Chicago area; however, there are a few things that prevents that from happening: (1) Poor Customer Service: When we arrived, we were "greeted" by a not-so-friendly and inattentive front desk clerk. He curtly asked for my friend's credit card and other information all while talking on the phone. He never asked if we needed additional information regarding public transit, tours, or the other services provided by the hotel (i.e. salon, store, restaurant and bar, gift shop, etc.). He treated us as if we were an inconvience to him. When I tried to request an additional towel set that evening, he told me to "come downstairs" to retrieve the towel set. (2) Quality of the Rooms: While our room was spacious and clean, it was aged. There needs to be major renovations to each of the rooms. The carpet was old and had spots and the linens were dated as well. Even the number plates outside of the rooms were chipped and needed replacing. The lighting was poor and the closets can be expanded to match the size of the room. (3) Promoting the Additional Services: No one told us about all the offerings of the hotel; we had to discover them by walking on the main floor. If Chicago South Loop Hotel wants to generate revenue for these shops, it may want to mention that as a service to customers upon check-in and offer discounts for those who may need them. The highlight of our stay would be Taron, the bellman. He was super courteous and attentive. He walked with us across the street and showed us -- on his phone -- the arrival times for the next bus. He gave us directions to Navy Pier and the Watertower. We gave him our phone number and he asked us (via text) if we got to our desired location. He gave us information regarding Chicago's popular nightspots and eateries. He even helped us search for one of the ladies' car keys. The level of service Taron provided should be a reflection of the service we are expected to receive at the front desk and by every staff member, it should not have been the exception. Overall, if you are looking for an inexpensive place to stay for family and class reunions, this spot is optimal. But if you want a complete hotel experience, then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel; Very Friendly/Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Johnbraggjr
Reviews.Content: I stumbled onto this hotel by chance, but am very happy I did. The staff (Victor and Regina) went out of their way to help us get settledin and ensure ourbstay was a comfortable one. The hotel itself is peaceful, clean, and relaxing, and a real bargain for the business or leisure traveler alike.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: ashleyhugh88
Reviews.Content: For being a bit south of the city, this place was amazing! we never had any problems being able to ask the friendly staff like Regina how to get where we were going. If I came back to Chicago, I might want to be a bit closer to the city- but bus fare is cheap, there is free internet in the rooms, free coffee available and overall staying at this hotel has been a very pleasant experience!

Reviews.Title: “THANK YOU TO Regina.”
Reviews.Author: tekniq
Reviews.Content: Regina Hawthorne assisted me with getting my security deposit credited back to my credit card.. The deposit was pending on my account for 3 weeks and she assisted me by faxing my bank the information needed to credit the funds back to my account.. I had been battling with my bank about the security deposit for a few weeks before that and got no where with them.. Thank you Regina Hawthorne

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: Joe2896
Reviews.Content: The nice lady who checked us in (Kierra) was outstanding. We had some problems and she took care of them. (Because our problem was so large while she was helping me I was letting others go ahead of me because there were so many people in line. While helping the others she also fixed 4 others people problems.) And all this with a smile and none of the other guests got upset. Good thing my company is not in Chicago or I would hire her away from you. Congratulations on having such a great employee, Steaven J. Dorsie Owner: J & J Transportation, Medina, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “"I'm a repeat guest, and has dropped the rest!"”
Reviews.Author: peace44881
Reviews.Content: For the past 3 yrs. I've traveled to Chicago, and stayed at the Chicago South Loop Hotel since I'd attended a conference. I was always a guest at the Hilton Chicago, but the Chicago South Loop is my second home from home. To top it all off, was guest service representative Jackie Washington. Ms. Washingon is very professional, polite and makes you an important customer. The rooms at the Chicago South Loop are nice, and roomy. I loe the seating area in the rooms are very nice. Keep up the marvelous work! See you on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Close to convention centre, sketchy neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: wineshding
Reviews.Content: Great price for a clean, newer room. In a bit of a dogdy neighbourhood, but right on the bus line and close enough to walk to Convention Centre. No internet, only downstairs in the lobby. Good enough if you are here on business for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall place to stay”
Reviews.Author: woowoobabyroot
Reviews.Content: Was very impressed by the overall service and friendliness of all the employees, especially Evelyn. She made sure everything was right for me. Definitely would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service was amazing at the hotel, and loved the overall experience.”
Reviews.Author: BradRoot
Reviews.Content: Evelyn was amazing and very helpful with all my questions and concerns. I would visit this hotel just because of her service alone. The whole experience was awesome and would come back next time I stay in Chicago area.

Reviews.Title: “Better then I Expected”
Reviews.Author: PolicePatx2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chicago South Loop Hotel, a couple of times this year and each time I stay it gets better. The first time that I had visited the hotel I did not know what to expect because, it was not part of a larger chain hotel such as the Hyatt, Hilton and etc. The rooms are very spacious, free parking, the art in the lobby is beautiful and the staff is amazing. Upon checking in I was greeted by warm smiles from Evelyn and Renee, they welcomed me and acknowledge that they would be able to help me during my stay. The only thing that I wished the rooms had were microwaves or somewhere convenient to be able to heat up my food. Overall, this is a wonderful hotel at an amazing price.

Reviews.Title: “We Absolutely Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cyevents
Reviews.Content: I took 5 girls ages 10-14 for a girls week in Chicago, we stayed at Chicago South Loop. I have stayed at this hotel numerous times over the last two years. The great service is consistent, the rooms are always clean and the rates are reasonable. The staff is always friendly and now that they have added mini fridges to the rooms it was even better for traveling with kids. The hotel is perfectly located on the bus line and is only a short walk away from the train and Chinatown; where we had great food. The room was spacious enough to accommodate the six of us without our getting in each other's way, and there is even a workout room. The only thing missing is a microwave, we ate out a lot and threw away quite a bit of leftovers that could have been re-heated and eaten later. Overall this is a fantastic place and I can't wait till my next visit later this month.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: uptonhuang
Reviews.Content: Both concierge Victor and Jackie were extremely helpful! I'd definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You!”
Reviews.Author: tgreen839
Reviews.Content: You guys are awesome! There was a small error in our reservation and Evelyn at the front desk got everything cleared up and got us up to our room immediately. Thanks for the 5- Star service without the 5-Star price! I now know where I will be staying on all my future visits to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, I'll stay again..”
Reviews.Author: kimbrenson
Reviews.Content: Renee and Jacqueline were helpful when I needed to change rooms due to back problems and gave me a "vase" to put fresh flowers in that I received from a cousin while in town. Thank you soo much you were very nice and understanding. I will definitely stay in you hotel on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4th”
Reviews.Author: myfamilyisawesome67
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed during the 4th and the hotel took us to the fireworks! Thanks for making my kids happy and many thanks to the front desk and Renee. The bus driver was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Love to stay again”
Reviews.Author: Sirox
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over July 4th and had a great time. We didn't know where to see fireworks. The hotel had a bus that took us there! A special thanks to Renee for this. She was nice and made sure everyone was there to get back.

Reviews.Title: “House keeper Vickey (VICTORIA) was very helpful and polite person.”
Reviews.Author: habash
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for ten nights. This house keeper really made me enjoyed my stay. The house keeper name is vickey (victoria) she was very very polite to every quest in the hotel. she is very polite, nice and a wonderful person. Also, very hard working staff.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: pfalls
