Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and very helpful. Many thanks to Bernita, Sharon, Jacqueline, Victor and Taron. We were there for our family reunion and the hotel was conviently located.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious!”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel126
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were greeted by Evelyn and she took very good care of us. It did not take long to get our rooms. The rooms are very spacious and clean! There was a free parking lot with security, which was great! Overall, we had great service and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Dymin10
Reviews.Content: Bernita was so sweet and very helpful!!! I definitely will be coming back here

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: SunSeekerRon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business, enjoying a very spacious king size bed and room. Oddly enough the room was so big, it made the TV at the end of the room almost too small and too far away. At a $107.00 AAA rate, the price was very reasonable, particularly considering the free parking, which is within a controlled enclosure. ($25.00 to $45.00 for most parking right in the heart of Chicago) This hotel is a little removed from the towntown core but a two block walk to the bus stop and taking the #3 bus for $2.25 gets you right down town. (Cab ride apparently about $10.00) We actually walked back to the hotel from Millenium Park and it took us just over an hour. Felt quite safe, with a noticeable police presence in the area. Enjoyed breakfast at the attached hotel reataurant, having a delicious and fresh spinach omlette, hashbrowns with toast and OJ for $16.00 including tip. The hotel also has a onsight cafe, which offers a decent selection of baked goods and hot options perfect to get your day started. Found it odd that the room didn't have coffee makers, although they do at least have nice sized empty fridges for your use. Only complaint really was the considerable amount of long hair stuck to the shower wall - gross. Having said that though, my co-worker stayed across the hall in an identifical room, and had no such issues. Closest beer store was about 1 mile away, just outside Chinatown, so dont hold plan on doing a lot of sightseeing in this immediate area !! Liked this hotel and location enough that I plan on booking it again with my kids for two nights before the summer's over...

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for McCormick Place”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m always suspicious of hotels which have a lot of 4* or 5* ratings where the reviewer only has one review. Is it really that good that people who have never reviewed before go to the effort? Anyway I shouldnâ€™t have worried. The answer is that, while itâ€™s not that good, itâ€™s a fine budget choice very convenient for McCormick Place. Two of us stayed for 4 nights (should have been 5 â€“ see below) for Â£1,000 (~$165 per room per night incl of taxes, etc) booked through hotels.com. This compared very favorably with the downtown hotels offered by the convention which circa $220 per night + tax and were a long bus ride away. Our flight was cancelled and the hotel staff were very quick and efficient in the two phone calls I made (one saying we would be late and then the other saying we wouldnâ€™t be arriving until the next day). Having got there, the 1st room I was given had not been made up. Then I got a room with an iron which had so much stuff melted on the bottom it smelt when turned on. The hotel fixed both issues quickly. So, what do you get? The hotel is pleasant enough but in the middle of nowhere. The room was clean and the wifi worked well. Everything worked. Not the best shower in the world but Iâ€™ve had a lot worse. I think the closest non-hotel place for food is the McDonalds adjacent to McCormick Place â€“ a 10 minute walk. Others have said that itâ€™s a threatening neighbourhood. One cab driver turned off his location device when delivering us back one night as he didnâ€™t want a pick-up in the area. I didnâ€™t feel the neighbourhood was threatening nor did my female colleague who was quite happy to go running in the morning. I walked a fair amount in the area and we only once took a cab to the convention as it was raining. We never waited more than a few minutes for a cab. The bar is â€˜OKâ€™ â€“ bottled beer only and apparently not formally connected to the hotel as you cannot charge to the room. The cafÃ© is a bit of a dive but the one morning we ate there the food was fine. The exercise room has two joggers, two x-trainers and two bikes and a few free weights â€“ typical exercise room really! So, all in all, a good budget choice. As an aside I wonder how long it is before this review is relegated down the list but lots of 4* and 5* review from people with a single review!

Reviews.Title: “Love my stay and wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Revec2
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at Chicago South Loop Hotel check-in was wonderful very professional staff Kierra was very helpful with information surrounding the hotel. Room was clean and above expectation. This was stay but will not be my last! EC2

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: vwasshington
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the hotel, Jacqueline was the front desk attendant, was extremely helpful. I had cancelled my reservation due to sharing a room with a friend. However, I ended up needing the room. Jacqueline was able to reinstate my room. She was extremely patient and understanding. This sounds like the description of her job but there were other circumstances that required me to need my original reservation. She was able to defocus and defuse a potential hostile situation. This resulted into an enjoyable weekend. I also received excellent service from housing. Berrita was the housekeeper supervisor overheard me talking to another quest about my lost toiletry bag and before I could even ask for the items she had them placed in my room. I have never received this type of treatment at a hotel before. My sister works for the Marriott hotel company and I receive room rates at an employee rate and have never received this excellent treatment. I will never stay at any other hotel will in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations, front desk service disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Rgrace33
Reviews.Content: My corner room with two queen beds was booked using Priceline.com and is much nicer than I expected. It is huge with a desk and seating area, hugest closet I've ever seen in a hotel, big bathroom and comfy beds. If you are bringing a car, the location won't be a problem, but be prepared for parking fees at your destination. Despite having to pay to park everywhere we go, the hotel's low rates and free parking are stil saving us money. My only complaint is the front desk staff...they have only been moderately helpful and have made their minimal efforts seem like a chore each time we needed something, like recoding a room key or help finding our bearings on a map. After reading the other glowing reviews of customer service, I couldn't disagree more. Overall, however, I would stay here again. Free parking, free wifi, and big rooms are all perks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great service, will use again.”
Reviews.Author: sherrypicha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the opportunity to stay at your hotel on June 15, 2011. We had to stay in another hotel closer to Navy Pier the night prior, due to a conference. We are fortunate to have had a "back to back" experience with a hotel that cost us over $500 for the one evening, and the Chicago South Loop hotel. After staying at the "other" hotel, we were very refreshed to find a very warm and welcome feeling from your staff. Kevin Rowe was waiting for us at the door and greeted us very warmly, and had taken up our bags to our room. He was very warm and friendly. We met up with him in the elevator a few minutes later, and he struck up a conversation up in the elevator with us. It is this kind experiences that really make us feel as if we belong here. The rooms were very clean and very nice and spacious. We will make a point of recommending this hotel to our friends and family in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and convenient for conference center”
Reviews.Author: aperry_27
Reviews.Content: Rooms are large and clean. Front desk, Kierra and Kevin, were very helpful and helped book reservation for fantastic dinner through website opentable. They also guided us to good shopping and best place to find Cub's jerseys.

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: AKM4755
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious rooms; friendly, helpful staff. VERY convenient to University of Chicago, if driving, and, while not in the Loop, a short, convenient bus ride away. Good prices. Parking is free, and a limited number of spaces in a secure lot. Beds are very firm -- too firm for a solid night's sleep. Neighborhood is largely industrial, and very deserted -- you wouldn't want to walk any distance, particularly at night, but bus from loop stops right at hotel. Nothing else immediately around it. Except for the beds, we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sjdreamfighter
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews about this hotel before booking my room and I have to admit was a little skeptical. There are a lot of great reviews and a lot of reviews expressing the same concern, which is the neighborhood. I booked my room with South Loop anyways because It was a good deal, and I was going to be at a convention all day, So I wasnâ€™t going to leave my room that often. The hotelâ€™s dÃ©cor is very soul-ful. There is a lot of painting in the lobby. Which I would love to know who the artist is. The hotel has a fitness center, a restaurant , and complimentary wi-fi throughout the entire hotel. Oh, and I forgot to mention, They have FREE PARKING!I went a few blocks down to a Mexican restaurant which was very good. And the neighborhood didnâ€™t look sketchy at all .The first night I was there I realized I left my phone charger . I asked the front desk if they had any, and they stated that they did. Unfortunately they didnâ€™t. Monique and Kiera both went out of their way to continue to look for one and check their phone to see if the phoneâ€™s outlet would match. Neither of them worked but Monique stated that she might have a car charger. A few minutes later she came back and I tried the charger in my car and it worked. She stated that I could give it back at the end of my stay. Which I thought was very nice, considering that I was staying at the hotel for 3 days. I thought it was a really nice gesture for the girls to go out of their way to make sure I was happy. Overall the entire hotel staff was very friendly, and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good average hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaroleF
Reviews.Content: Amtrak put us up here when we missed our connection due to the Empire Builder arriving 12 hours late (apparently not unusual, be warned!!). A group of train refugees checked in close to 5am and were told check-out is normally 11am, but we could stay until noon. Someone asked if we could stay longer, and the receptionist said it might be possible if we ask the front desk in the morning. This attitude was very much appreciated. Apart from the thin carpet that had definitely seen better days, it was a large, pleasant room with free wifi that worked fine. The shower was great and the bed comfortable. There's only one elevator, but we didn't wait long. When we needed a taxi, an employee was immediately to hand and a cab was already there. (Fare to Union Station was about $12.50 plus tip). With our brief glimpse of the street, there appeared to be no businesses nearby, but I'm probably wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Renee is the best ambassador we have ever met! *manager :P”
Reviews.Author: Lisamccleney
Reviews.Content: Just great words for this hotel and staff! From the time that we checked in with super sweet Monique, Donte took our bags to our room, Victor always was helpful at the front desk, and Renee couldn't have made our stay more comfortable. Friendly staff also includes Patrick and Ronald! They're always happy to help and we were the first to receive a frig in our room... We have stayed in Boston, Atlanta, Orlando, San Francisco, but No One made us more comfortable and appreciated like the staff at this hotel. The bed was comfortable, we had a clean quiet rooms on the fifth floor and the elevator was huge! We used the 29 bus every day because pick up was across the street and drop off was right in front. We did not need parking but we knew it was available if we decided to rent a car. The bus was so easy and always had many modes of travel using the pass we got at Walgreen's.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Frick_inc
Reviews.Content: Just good words for this hotel! Friendly staff! They're always happy to help. Comfortable beds, clean quiet rooms (west side is above the bar so could be noisier late but not enough noisy not to sleep). Walking distance to McCormick exhibition place. Super easy 29 bus route (always have a seat too!) and 15 mins max time to get to downtown. If you fall asleep on the bus, you will end-up to Pier 21, Chicago must see attraction! Buy a transit pass is your best bet (sold at all Walgreens pharmacies). Would definitely go back to this hotel! Oh, free wi-fi and fridge in the room too!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Etienne60763
Reviews.Content: Very nice poeple, good hotel, clean, not far from downtown with a great gym. Prices were also very good, I highly recommand this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, clean hotel, nice time”
Reviews.Author: paulbrecht35
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the South Loop Hotel during a convention at McCormick Center. It was a great location, a very nice hotel, and had great service. Evelyn Yee at the front desk was particularly great. She gave us a fantastic dinner recommendation (Joy Yee's Noodle Shop) and was very knowledgeable about the area and was fun to talk to. She went out of her way several times to make sure our stay was as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. The only negative thing I can say about this hotel is that the beds aren't super comfortable, but all-in-all, we had a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Bhua
Reviews.Content: If it weren't for Steve in the front desk, I would be sleeping in my car. I arrived 12 hours early before my check in. Steve Went the extra mile and got me my room on an early check in! The room was excellent and larger than most hotels. I was highly impressed and grateful! Thank you Chicago South Loop Hotel and Steve for the excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Not good. Not bad. The South Loop Hotel just "is"...”
Reviews.Author: Schmengi9
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just completed a three-night stay at the Chicago South Loop Hotel, which we booked through HW. On the upside, the hotel lobby is spacious and attractive, and I thought our rooms and the hotel in general were pretty clean and well maintained. On more of the realistic side of things (versus the downside), the Chicago South Loop Hotel is probably just a little shy of what most folks would consider to be a three-star hotel, and it really is not in the South Loop neighborhood of Chicago by my estimation. Location-wise, I would say 26th and State streets is at least a half-mile south of what most would consider the South Loop. The hotel is even south of Chinatown! The free surface parking behind the hotel was a nice amenity for a hotel near central Chicago, but also a necessity considering the location. As you approach the hotel for the first time, you may arrive at the same conclusion my friends and I did: that the hotel is in the middle of absolutely nowhere, which in many respects it is. However, upon closer review, you are about a 10-12 minute walk to the Cermak-Chinatown L station a half-mile to the north, and a short distance by car to I-55 and Lake Shore Drive. Itâ€™s also not a bad place to stay if youâ€™re in town to attend a White Sox game, with US Cellular Field about a 20 minute walk south and west from the hotel (though itâ€™s best to walk west on 26th and then south through the Bridgeport residential neighborhood than south along State to 35th past some vacant lots and slightly distressed housing). Once in the hotel, I found our rooms to be fine. Both rooms we had were pretty spacious by hotel standards but plainly decorated, with white walls and an overall lack of interior design and adornment. Most importantly, the rooms were clean and my bed was pretty comfortable. However, the AC units in one of the rooms got a little noisy after prolonged usage and had to be shut off in order to get some sleep. One of our rooms was skipped for service after the first night. Strangely, hotel staff had been in the room, because when we left the first morning, the room had no refrigerator and the room was configured differently, but when we returned in the late afternoon, we the furniture had been moved to make room for a small, seemingly new fridge. However, the beds and bath hadnâ€™t been touched. We called housekeeping after the second night before we left for the day and came back to find both rooms freshened up. No new appliances, though! :o) We didnâ€™t patronize the hotel lounge, gift shop or diner, so I wonâ€™t comment on those. I used the fitness room twice during our stay and was generally pleased. The photo online is a little misleading, but the fitness room includes 2 treadmills, 2 elliptical machines, 2 stationary bikes, a multi-purpose weight machine and some free weights. Nothing too elaborate, but enough to allow you to get a little workout in during your stay. As hotels are concerned, you can do a lot better than this hotel in Chicago but you certainly can do a lot worse. At the end of the day, I donâ€™t know that I can recommend the Chicago South Loop Hotel to a friend, but if I got it again through a bid on PL or HW, I could make it work.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous property”
Reviews.Author: ADBROWNTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: BERNITA, Supervisor of Housekeeping was very helpful and informative. The property houses a full service resturant, sports lounge, convenience store, business center, coffee shop, full service beauty salon, banquet rooms, conference meeting rooms and FREE PARKING. Everything is conveniently located on the 1st floor. I stopped an employee of the hotel and hit a gold mine. . I was able to see both the king rooms and new double rooms including micro & fridge. I am impressed. Thanks Bernita!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: 2bowdens
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago on the night of May 11 2011 due to Amtrak having service problems as our train was 7 hours late. Amtrak provided us lodging for the night at the Chicago South Loop Hotel-I was a bit skeptical since this was downtown Chicago but from the time my husband and I walked in the door we felt welcomed. Renee at the desk went beyond our expectations at making us feel comfortable. Our rooms were very spacious and very clean. I was very concerened as we were going to have to book a flight to return home to Alabama due to Amtrak having service interruptions between Chicago & New Orleans-our starting point on our 2 week vacation. I had never flown before and needed to purchase on line tickets for the next day. Renee helped me with this process and even printed our Boarding Passes for us. Again she exemplies excellent Customer Service! Thank you Renee for everything you did for us.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, staff not!”
Reviews.Author: taves4
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying that I read the other reviews and I agree that the staff wasn't the best. I was there for a baby shower on a Saturday afternoon and when it was over, we started to load the cars with the gifts. The only people who weren't doing anything were the couple expecting and the kids that were at the shower. Everyone else had left except for the people who were helping with the gifts. It only took a few minutes to get everything in the cars and to get the rest of our things so we could go and as we are putting on our coats, a guy (restaurant manager maybe) comes in and starts yell "You need to leave now!" The shower actually ended before the time it was suppose to, so we were still under our contracted time when we were cleaning up. I should have known then to cancel my room for that night. I had went out to eat later that evening and when we came back, the front desk area was chaotic. There was a guy at the end of the counter talking to a lady and man behind the counter about the music on his iphone and how she can put music on hers. There was another lady behind the counter on the phone helping the guy in front of me and then the girl I had talked to earlier came from the back. Now my experience at other hotels has been, when a customer comes up to the counter you greet them and either say how can I help you or I will be with you shortly. We got neither. The first thing that was said to us, after 5 minutes, was â€œis that yâ€™all? Yâ€™all been smoking?â€�. I was truly offended. I donâ€™t know what made her even say those things. Iâ€™m a customer and that is how I get greeted. UNACCEPTABLE! I ever so nicely, without getting too loud, said â€œexcuse me? I donâ€™t do those things and donâ€™t think that is what you should be saying to a customer.â€� Mind you, nowhere in the area was there a â€œweedâ€� smell. I guess she wanted some weed really bad. Maybe the hotel should start drug testing their employees. We finally get check into our room and it looks like a nice room but not the one I ordered. I requested a King size bed and was clearly stated on my confirmation email. I received a double queen room. I called the front desk and said I wanted the King room and she rudely said they were sold out. Now most other reviews said the area wasn't nice or safe and there wasnâ€™t many places to eat nearby. I don't really agree. I think like any other major city, you shouldn't walk alone at night in unfamiliar places and you should be aware of your surroundings. I do agree however, that all entrances except the front door should be locked after 10pm. When I came back in at midnight, the door on the side was not locked. As far as places nearby to eat, yes there arenâ€™t many places within walking distance but you are only a few minutes from downtown. Hop a cab, and go eat or order something. Iâ€™m not sure I will stay here again if they have the same rude, donâ€™t want to work staff.

Reviews.Title: “Brotrippin with Adam”
Reviews.Author: adambrotrippin
Reviews.Content: Renee was great and couldn't have helped any more. She hooked us up with a taxi and some sweet laundry service. Victor got us an awesome room and told us the hotspots downtown.

Reviews.Title: “The people was nice”
Reviews.Author: mzwrong
Reviews.Content: well everyone i saw was nice they smile and say hi to me Ms. Evelyn check us in and she was very helpful and she help us with all the question we had., you have a great hotel and i will let all my family and friend know about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: adventurer11_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chicago South Loop Hotel for four nights while attending a convention at the McCormack Center. it is an easy walk to and from the Center (ten minutes) Saves time and money. Taxi fares to downtown for dinner or adventure are very reasonable. Our room was spacious and nice. staff Evelyn,Kierra,Victor and Diane were quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the South Loop Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedMontgomeryAlabama
Reviews.Content: We came to Chicago for a wedding and The South Loop Hotel was the host hotel. We enjoyed the service, the cleanliness, the food and entertainment. Ms. R. Hall (Management), Mr. Patrick Hall (Janitor) and Ms. Cheryl (Housekeeping) all deserve accommadations for their professionalism, good customer service and friendliness. We will stay here again and we highly recommend it to others. For the price you can not beat it! Free secure parking too! Mr. & Mrs. McGruder

Reviews.Title: “Cost effective and good”
Reviews.Author: WorkRelated123
Reviews.Content: The hotel has everything a business traveler needs and was a great value. We had a show at McCormick Place and it worked out really well. Diane at the front desk was a HUGE help for me... i had brought the family along on the trip and she made it easy and convenient for my wife and children to have extra time to get out of the room the last day! Thanks Diane!!

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFICENT STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicki1978
Reviews.Content: Our group was completely impressed with this hotel. The attractive, spotless, professional atmosphere allowed us to relax. The staff went out of our way to accomadate us. We would like to personally thank Jackie, Patrick, Kierra, and Sharronda for helping us with our accomadations and directions. This affordable hotel also granted us free parking. It will be ideal for us to book a future function or bring our families back for recreation. Thanks again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a very decent stay!”
Reviews.Author: jnflmg12
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with our recent stay. The room was very clean, the bathtub was nice and big, and the walk in closet was a nice touch (although not really used). The bed was a little uncomfortable, but that's really my only complaint. We did have to park on the street a block away one night when we returned after midnight to find no spots available, but it was patrolled by police regularly so we had no issues. By the way, the free parking is GREAT. What a fantastic amenity. The neighborhood was quiet, the staff was friendly and helpful and it wasn't far from everywhere we wanted to go. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: eman2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Chicago South Loop Hotel on at least 10 times and I'll always stay there if they have an openning. The staff is always friendly and Ron Bowers helped me out with internet connectivity when I really needed it! I've had great experiences with the food and entertainment at L26 on the east end, as well as breakfast on the west end in the Cafe. Say hi to Tony in L26 or the lounge! With a great location, mins from downtown, the Chicago South Loop Hotel is quiet, clean, and convienient! Mr. Jones

Reviews.Title: “Bernita!”
Reviews.Author: Lfwilliams
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful individual! Kudos to the Chicago South Loop Hotel for hiring this capable individual. Bernita represents excellence personified and she represents the company well. This is about more than good housekeeping services. This is about potential and ability that I certainly hope the hotel recognizes and appreciates enough to do whatever is necessary to maintain and develop. Thank you, Bernita! You ROCK!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service From Reception”
Reviews.Author: Prince1234586
Reviews.Content: When I checked into the Hotel I was checked in at the front desk by Kierra. I am new to the Chicago area and had many questions about restuarants and stores in the Chicago area. She was very very helpful and found some great places for me. I will recommend this hotel to my clients and to my staff. Also Kevin on the Bell Desk was very helpful and informative as well. Terry Smith.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miker747
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice in the last nine months. I also recommended this hotel to a friend. The staff is very friendly. The room and bathroom are huge. The hotel is tastefully decorated. It also has FREE parking. We buy a bus pass to explore the city. CTA bus 29 drops us off at the side of the hotel. What could be easier than that? We are planning on visiting Chicago again this summer. I am planning on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value for location close to convention center.”
Reviews.Author: tfhtfh
Reviews.Content: Incredible value for location close to convention center (10 to 15 minute walk). Reasonable rate. Clean, nice room. Friendly helpful staff. Free convenient parking. Not much in immediate area (restaurants).

Reviews.Title: “great location, great price, clean, friendly, easy to find, and free parking!”
Reviews.Author: mscrystylz
Reviews.Content: our stay here was very nice. the staff was beyond helpful and kind. this hotel not only met our expectations but to be honest our expectations were exceeded. i will stay here everytime i visit chicago. everything we needed was within reach. i lucked up on this hotel on the internet and i am so glad i found it.. thanks chicago south loop! (also ronald was excellent)

Reviews.Title: “overall great customer service”
Reviews.Author: katriche
Reviews.Content: the employees were great. the hotel was clean and spacious..it was so cozy and relaxing. everyone was so helpful. all of our needs were met. this hotel exceeding our expectations. there were three employees that really stood out, donta, patrick and victor. we will definitely stay here again if we ever come back to chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Don't eat at the sports bar here.”
Reviews.Author: laurensmiles
Reviews.Content: We just spent several hours getting a "quick" bite to eat in the sports bar in this hotel as we were afraid to go outside to find someplace else since this area of the city is not the best and the actual restaurant was not open. First, they gave my salad to my fiance with chicken on top, which I did not order. There was no creamy balsalmic dressing on it so I was waiting for them to bring that, and my fiance's salad was still nowhere to be found. Instead, they took my salad back and it took another half an hour for the rest of our food to come, including my correct salad. And not including the cup of soup I ordered. My fiance, however, had been given the wrong salad. Neither of us were given dressing this time either. So while we waited for that, the bartender went back to find out if my fiance could get the salad he ordered instead of the one he was given. He ended up just eating the wrong salad, and I was so hungry that I ate half of mine before we were even given dressing (blue cheese and italian; neither of which were what was supposed to come with my salad in the first place). No soup to be found. We asked for it again. I ended up being pretty hungry once I finished my salad, so while the bartender made up our checks I asked if I just wasn't going to have any soup. I was still hungry and about to work until 4am with a half-empty stomach for 12 hours. As we were leaving, my soup came out and I had to finish it in about 30 seconds. The worst part was that the bartender was apparently supposed to pay for the kitchen's (frequent and bad) mistakes... she comped my fiance's salad and used her tips to pay for it, so we felt bad and gave her the money for his meal anyway. She definitely didn't deserve to be treated the way the kitchen was treating her, and after she spent three hours trying to get them to make our food, she shouldn't have to pay for it herself. I had been in the car since very early this morning driving to Chicago and now I'm sitting in my room, exhausted and upset instead of enjoying myself like I should be. At least I finally got to eat something. The front desk and bellhop were very helpful; just please get ahold of your kitchen. There wasn't even anyone else ordering food in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Bother”
Reviews.Author: dbrown7316
Reviews.Content: Dont even bother with this hotel. The picture are acurate, but the little things dont show. The front desk staff was new and poorly trained. The sports bar and resturant attached were not impressive and priced too high for the bad quality of food. The room was decent, nothing to brag about. The bed was like sleeping on a rock. The parking lot was nice because it is gated but has the size to fit a couple of hot wheels cars. The thing that bothered me the most was the start and end of my stay. When i booked the room i booked the Shedd Package, which includes 2 VIP tickets (which were described as tickets that allow me to surpass lines anywhere, which is not the case, AT ALL) to the aquarium. Upon arrival i asked about the tickets and was told they are waiting at Will Call. I veririfed that as i walked away and was told "yes, theyll be waiting there for you". I woke up the next morning to go to the aquarium with my girlfriend and was told that i do not get to skip the line and that i had to wait in line for my tickets. We waited an hour to get to the will call desk and got to the desk and was told that there we not tickets waiting for us. I contacted the hotel and was hung up on by the front desk person, at which point i decided it wasnt worth it and we didnt get into the aquarium. When following up with the hotel the next morning, I spoke with a lady at the desk i wasn't familiar with and was given attitude when i asked for a manager.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: ohhsosammy07
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Chicago South Loop hotel was a very enjoyable time, the rooms were big amd it wasn't overaly expensive. The service was great, especially the concierge Dave was very helpful with our questions about Chicago and helping us make sure our time was well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Free Parking”
Reviews.Author: JustJeri
Reviews.Content: I don't like to be negative. I thought I knew what I was getting into when I made reservations here. Colleagues had told me that this wasn't much more than a place to sleep. I love Chicago, and I know where to stay when I'm in town for fun. This time I was there for work, an Expo at McCormick Place. There were 2 things that really appealed to me about the South Loop - FREE Parking & proximity to McCormick. First night, there was a fight on my floor. I don't know the details & I fully realize people can be stupid no matter the environment. The ruckus lasted off & on for a couple of hours until the police arrived, around 5am. What's funny is when I called down later in the morning to inquire about access to the hotel safe, the staff member who answered the phone said, "Yes, ma'am, the hotel is safe. The police station is 2 blocks away," I knew at that moment, the staff had been coached to address the incident. Second night there was a loud disagreement between staff members in the hall. I heard their voices, peeped out the hole, saw one guy pushing a cart, another guy telling him to do what he's told because he's the "F-ing boss". OK, then. Erica in the gift shop was so great, really enjoyed chatting with her. Even though I hurt her feelings a bit when I told her I brought my own snacks. (I brought my own coffee pot, too, as there is not one in the room.) Anyway, Erica suggested a place for dinner, couple blocks walk from the hotel. Carbon Live Fire Mexican Grill. I will be writing a review of that place, too. I enjoyed it & thank Erica for the suggestion! I did duck into the coffee shop. I brought food with me, I always do when I travel, but one morning I really needed an egg sandwich. The woman behind the counter wasn't very pleasant. The place smelled like old grease. I almost left, but I realized I could actually see her prep the food, so that comforted me a bit. Though I traveled alone, there were people I knew staying at the hotel, too. One of my peers checked into her room to find someone had defecated on the floor & well, I won't describe any of the details. My personal experience with my room was that it was cleanish. I've seen better, but sadly I've seen worse! Many of the reviews mention Miss Jackie & she is a sweet lady. Tommy was helpful. I think they care, but are hobbled by things out of their control. Through certain discount sites, you can get a ridiculous rate on a stay here. I was in town for 5 nights, with my personal vehicle for work. I wanted to save money. Chicago South Loop gave me exactly what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: shasha0777
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on Priceline. I've never had a problem with Priceline when booking hotels. I think they're great. I called in the afternoon before my arrival to confirm my reservation and to inform them that I would be a late check in since my flight was arriving late. When I arrived to the hotel at 1am they didn't have my reservation. I had printed my reservation and receipt and had it with me. The front desk employee told me they were updating their system and it may have been that my reservation was canceled. Sure good thing I had my print out. The employee made a new reservation for me and got me a room about an hour later. He tried calling Priceline for me but was unsuccessful at reaching anyone. So I called them myself, I was on hold for a long time. At 3am, when I was already settled in and ready to go to sleep, I got a call from the front desk asking to come back so that they can get a copy off all my info because it could not wait till the morning. After that I went back to the my room and called Priceline again. It was about 3:30am. I called the front desk while talking to Priceline and the guy at the front desk said they had found my reservation. It was filed in the wrong spot. It was pretty annoying. As far as the hotel goes, the lobby is really nice. But it's almost like a facade. Once you go the hallway and rooms it goes down one star. The rooms could be updated. Things look old which make it look dirty. But for the most part it's a clean hotel. The rooms are big along with the bathroom. Also, it's loud. You hear everyone who walks past your door. And we were next to the ice machine room so we got to hear that too. The good thing is is that the bus to downtown is across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: lmsicia
Reviews.Content: I stay regularly for business. The staff remember me and make me feel welcome. Shout out to Kevin R, Ronald, and Jackie at the front desk for always making my stay so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Mc Cormick Center”
Reviews.Author: WRD70
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large and very clean. a short walk to the McCormick center( 18 minutes with wife walking slow ). Staff was very helpful. Easy bus or taxi ride to downtown. The internet was very slow but it was being worked on. Front desk help was super. The restaurant in the hotel is not operated by the hotel but the food is excellent and the price is average. The only drawback was the breakfast service was very slow. We ate one dinner there and the service and food were great. Very Busy bar with great bar food from the restaurant next door.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Chicago South Loop Hotel was a wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: JoEllenTaylor
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a long weekend in Chicago with my two young adult children, and I was more than satified with our accommodations at the Chicago South Loop Hotel. Our room was very large and clean, and the beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was remarkable, with one of the largest hotel bathtubs I have ever seen! The hotel has an amazing jazz feel, mostly due to the beautiful artwork displayed on the main level. It also boasts a resteraunt, lounge, deli, salon, fitness room, business center, and a small gift shop. Parking was plentiful and free - an unusual combination among Chicago hotels. The staff was friendly and helpful, and made us feel very much at home. The only downside was a lack of rerigerator in the room. It would also be nice if the gift shop had "set " hours instead of the sporadic hours it was open. All in all, though, we had a wonderful visit, and I would not hesitate to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Chicago South Loop Hotel is an excellent value with a wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: dryridgepaul
Reviews.Content: As usual, I bid for a hotel through Priceline. My experiences have been mixed, from excellent to miserable, having at one place being made to feel guilty for going through Priceline, like I'm cheap--outright anger exhibited towards me and Priceline. Not true at the Chicago South Loop. They made me feel like I paid the rack rate. Priceline entered the wrong arrival date. When I showed them the confirmation (always take it with you), they apologized for the error (obviously not their fault), and even upgraded the room (without being asked). They even took the time to map out a safe personal walking map to local restaurants and attractions. The room and bathroom was one of the largest I've ever experienced. The only thing lacking for me personally was that I could've used a coffee maker and small refridgerator. There was plenty of free secured parking (significant in Chicago), and was close (2-3 miles) to downtown. I feel this hotel deserves 3 to 3-1/2 stars, rather than the 2-1/2 it has now. Again, the thing I liked most was the staff, and that it is "Priceline-friendly", and you Priceline regulars know exactly what I'm talking about. I find no fault with this hotel at all, and a lot to praise about. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a jewel”
Reviews.Author: Bastet13
Reviews.Content: The staff was outstanding. The rooms were very large and the tubs to die for. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that appreciates great service.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday during Snowstorm of the year”
Reviews.Author: lisapleasant
Reviews.Content: While on a business trip during the snowstorm of the year,my husband was stuck in Chicago on his birthday. I called to see if I could send up a piece of cake or something. Todd S. politely informed me that didn't have anything but offered to get something from the local store. I was happy and shocked all at the same time. He then asked what I wanted on the card! I thought this type of service didn't exist anymore. You just can't go wrong with these folks. It would do the chain hotels some good to come here and see what real guest service is all about.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Natsue23
Reviews.Content: The rooms were big and clean. Service and location were horrible. I highly recommend staying downtown for the extra money. We tried to get some drinks from the bar, but we must have missed the sign that said, "We don't serve whites." We literally sat there trying to waive the bartender down, and she didn't even look at us. She did a really good job at acting like we were invisible. A couple weeks after the vacation, I got a call from a Chicago bank confirming that I had written a check to some woman for babysitting. Someone had gone through my purse in our hotel room and tore out the last two checks in my checkbook. I guess your personal belongings are never safe in a hotel room! By the look of recent posts, it looks like they did some firing and hiring of new people. I wouldn't worry about it too much, just be cautious.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: PaulPleasant
Reviews.Content: The location is not the best in Chicago, but that is the only thing you could find wrong with the Chicago South Loop Hotel. The rooms are large, clean, and newly furnished but the best thing about this hotel is the staff. The front desk staff were always smiling and went to the effort to make sure I had a birthday surprise when my wife called and told them I would be alone when I turned 45. Kevin Rowe, the best bellman I have met, cleaned off my car and had it warmed up for me when I went back to work after a big snowstorm (us old guys need a little extra help you know). The neighborhood is not bad, just a south of the action in downtown Chicago. If your staying in Chicago and need a clean place and friendly voices, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “I felt as protected and safe as I do in my little hometown.”
Reviews.Author: PKoz52
Reviews.Content: As a single adult female, it is sometimes a little scary to travel to a big city alone. I face my fears head on and try not to take unnecessary chances. One does hear horror stories out in the "burgs" about the Big City and how Dangerous it is to travel there alone. Especially,in "certain parts of the city". I love the Southside. I have for many years. I love to see the new construction and the renovations to this beleaguered part of the city. I also love the people. The diverse ethnic and racial groups fascinate me. I am able to experience what it feels like to be a "minority". I am caucasian by birth. But if one were to judge me by enthusiasm for life...well,that's a horse of a different color. So I find myself, at 12:30 AM on a Saturday morning in a Southside Chicago Hotel lobby, wondering..."should I go straight to my room or hang around and wait for the crowds to dissipate". Kevin Rowe was on duty. And he stayed beyond his official "off time". He escorted me to my floor and saw me safely to my door. I felt safe. I felt protected. I felt "cared for". Thank You Kevin. and thank you to Tommy,Lucia,Mary and the rest of the staff who took the time to see to my needs...for information...for courteous,warm service...for a friendly face...and a bit of a chat.Thank you to all of you. Now,a pool would have been lovely...I do love to swim. Information in the room about the hotel and the accomodations would have been handy also. Didn't know about the Awake with Pearl Coffee Cafe...so missed breakfast. Had a great night's rest. It was peaceful,quiet and uninterrupted. All in all,it was a great experience and yes, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value and friendly”
Reviews.Author: j68_10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel by accident thinking it was as different one (long and not particularly interesting story!), and ended up very pleased with it. It's excellent value for money. My room was very large, with a separate sitting area with comfortable chairs and coffee table, and the sleeping area itself was also large, with a work desk. The room came with free wired internet access (cabling supplied) which was very much appreciated. The bathroom was also good with a large, deep bath. Everything was spotlessly clean. The room was warm and quiet. The staff I came into contact with (Todd on front desk and Sandra (I think) at breakfast were friendly, welcoming and helpful, which does add so much to a hotel stay. The price tells you that this is not a luxury hotel, but I think that you get far more for your money here than the price suggests. There are obviously frills you don't get, but they are really not an issue. There is no coffee maker in the room (although there are water cups), but there is a cafe on the ground floor. Frankly I'd rather have it that way and get the free in-room internet access than pay the extortionate daily internet rate that so many more expensive hotels charge. The hotel is not central and there's not too much around it (although I understand it's handy for the conference centre and Chinatown), but there is a bus (no.29) which leaves for downtown directly opposite the hotel and drops you back off right in front of the hotel. It leaves every 15 mins, costs $2.25 for a single ride and got me from the hotel to the Art Institute in around 15 mins. I found it super-handy and it made not being located in central downtown a complete non-issue. As well as the cafe there is a restaurant and bar. I only used the restaurant for breakfast - warning: breakfast portions are large! I ordered more items than I could eat, thinking they'd be much smaller. All well cooked. Breakfast is ordered a la carte, rather than buffet, and is reasonably priced. I wasn't in a hurry, which was fine, but if you are expecting a dash-in, dash-out buffet option, you should probably leave a bit more time than you would normally. Sandra was an excellent hostess. So, overall it's not a luxury hotel, but it doesn't provide budget-level service or accommodation. The staff is friendlier and more helpful and the rooms bigger, cleaner and better equipped than I've had in many far more expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation away from home”
Reviews.Author: lcpenn
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful, enjoyous weekend at a historical hotel. Billy Holiday, Cab Caloway, Duke Ellington, Ella Fitzgerald and all the great Jazz and Blues Legends were there. The ambuiance is one to die for. Service was extrodinary and warm. Why spend thousand's of dollar's when you can stay at this exclusive hotel and receive the same if not better service.

Reviews.Title: “Stains on the Sheets!”
Reviews.Author: myplantherman
Reviews.Content: After flying for hours, dealing with airport security, baggage claims, and car rentals, all I wanted to do was get into a bed and sleep. When I got to my room, I pulled back the covers and there was a giant white stain on the blanket beneath the comforter. Bet you can't guess what that was. I called down for new bedding and it took them almost an hour to bring it. And by bringing it I mean dumping it on the floor outside the door, knocking, and walking away. Not even an apology. Terrible beds and furniture too. The bathroom was recently remodeled, but they didn't put in a new shower head. It was so incrusted from hard water that it sprayed in a dozen different directions. Absolutely terrible stay. Something more like what I'd expect from a $40 a night motel.

Reviews.Title: “Jackie you're the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: DenBridges
Reviews.Content: We stayed here due to the close proximity to Soldier Field. The free parking, nice bar and restaurant, along with the excellent customer service, are the major reasons I will return to this hotel for business or pleaure trips. Big spacious rooms as well. Thank you Jackie for your thoughtfulness!!

Reviews.Title: “We are coming back for more!”
Reviews.Author: mistamorrow
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a room on December 20,2010 and it was a great visit. The staff was very professional, fast, and friendly. During our stay I noticed that the staff made sure that you could get into the snow filled parking lot. All night they patroled the lots to remove snow and ice. Kudos to them!! Our room was very spacious, clean, and cozy. We both were impressed by the huge bathtub, and the nice view. Thank you South Loop staff member Jackie. We will be there again for Valentines Day!!!! The pictures of the Chicago South Loop are correct !!! I recommend coming here first!

Reviews.Title: “Free parking? Yes, please!”
Reviews.Author: sinistas
Reviews.Content: After a week of searching for street parking at another hotel, I looked specifically for hotels in Chicago with free parking. The South Loop Hotel was one of the few that matched up with my needs, and it's turned out great. The staff are fantastic, especially Kevin Rowe, who helped with our bags several times. There's a cool cafe downstairs I've hit up a couple of times, though I wish they opened a bit earlier - had to be on the road before 7 a few times. I attempted to check out the SL Sports Lounge, but there was *nobody* there. No staff, no customers. Completely empty at 5pm...not a good sign so I ordered in instead. In any case, the South Loop has been fantastic and if I ever come back to Chicago, it's at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “South Loop Hotel - remarkable value”
Reviews.Author: jawhitney
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel convenient to the Museum of Science and Industry. The South Loop Hotel is about six miles from the Museum, but the drive is really easy and quick. Victor helped a lot at check-in, giving us suggestions on dining in the area of the hotel. We ate at the in-house restaurant, L26, and found the food very good, although the bar seemed limited on some selections (no port or sherry). We were very satisfied with the room. Both the room and the bathroom were large and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Great price”
Reviews.Author: shutterbug44
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel by accident when I googled to see what was closest to the location of my business meeting. It is in a great location and I can see the downtown skyline from my room. The rooms are basic no frills, but comfortable and clean. The staff is friendly and accomodating. The first room I was put in was freezing and even after having the heat on fully blast for an hour I was freezing. I called down and they promptly moved me to a warm and cozy room. They have free parking, which is definetly a plus in downtown. The price can't be beat $84 for a AAA rate.

Reviews.Title: “If you go to Chicago, you should stay here - simple as that!”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasAmtraker
Reviews.Content: We are regulars but I always like to throw a good word or two at this establishment. Todd Soliday, the wonderful manager, runs a tight but friendly ship. The staff is busy and helpful. The rooms, hallways and public areas are clean and well-maintained. The beds are super comfortable. The food in the little funky cafe is excellent. The streets around the hotel aren't too busy so the sleep is sound. And, yes, parking is right outside and FREE. Try that downtown. My wife and I had a plane to catch at Ohare. We went into the business office and got on one of the free computers and saw when the next bus was coming. We walked across the street and caught it. We got off downtown and walked a block and caught the blue line train. And we were delivered to Ohare. All for about $2.25 or whatever a bus ticket costs. So you can get anywhere with ease from the hotel. Chinatown is just a few blocks away - easy walk or very short drive. And all for a very reasonable price. You really can't beat this place with a stick no matter what city you put it but especially in a big city where prices can be high.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised, the website photos are accurate, the service was friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: knhd976
Reviews.Content: As advertised, the website photos are accurate, the service was friendly and helpful. I did not eat at the restaurant but it did smell good :) They do have gated free parking. My King room had a huge 6' soaking bath tub (non-jetted). The elevated train is nearby but did not affect my sleep, you may want to request a room on the opposite wing if the train noise is a bother. No air whistle(s), just track noise.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: SoINtraveler
Reviews.Content: What a great little secret we found just south of downtown Chicago! We had a spacious, comfortable room with a nice size bathroom as well. The large soaking tub was a definite hit with my husband! Great customer service seems to have fallen by the wayside at so many places anymore, but NOT at this hotel! No matter how busy he was, Victor provided top-notch customer service to each and every guest and always with a smile. The bellman Kevin was always handy to assist with luggage, hunt down a Do-Not-Disturb tag, or anything else you might need. I wish more companies would realize the importance and value of great employees in their interactions with customers. We stayed Wed. - Fri. including New Years Eve. When planning our trip, we found many downtown hotels really jacked up the rates for New Years (up to 4 times what they wanted for the other nights). CSLH's rate for New Years was only slightly higher than our first two nights and I would guess that was simply due to the weekend rate. Such a fine hotel that's so close to downtown and at such a great value, it's a real gem! We truly enjoyed our stay and look forward to staying again on our next trip to the Windy City. Great room, great customer service, and great value as well!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: souldog
Reviews.Content: My stay at the south.loop hotel was delightful. Andrew at the front desk got me in my room early an fast. The only problem I had was with the heat n the room was not working but Ronald the maintenance man took care of that real fast an got me ice an cups for my guests. A big ups to Ronald. I will be back SOON.Thanks ssnnaakkee

Reviews.Title: “Best place to come back home to.”
Reviews.Author: ConferenceTrips077
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference, and needed a hotel near the conference center. Not only was the Chicago South Loop Hotel within easy walking distance of my conference, but the rooms were clean, comfortable, and easily large enough to allow my group to meet up and make plans. I've never been in a hotel room with that much extra room, and especially for someone traveling with multiple other people and a lot of luggage, it was perfect. The staff were helpful above and beyond all expectation, giving us directions and recommendations to the conference, restaurants, parking, and even getting out of town. They were also extremely helpful in allowing us to all check-in and check-out as our various carpool groups arrived and left at different times. It was truely a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, convenient, clean and comfortable as always.”
Reviews.Author: imapeg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient to the IIT and VanderCook College of Music campus, is clean and has reasonable rates. There is a bus right outside that takes you to campus in one direction, or downtown the other, excellent for combining vacation and visiting your college students. We have utilized this hotel many times, it has always been clean, comfortable, and very reasonably priced. Parking is free, a real plus in the Chicago area! Very easy to park and use mass transit the rest of your stay. There is no pool, no kitchenette or some of the other fancy amenities, but if you are looking for the basics at a good price with the atmosphere and pleasant staff of a higher-end hotel, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Service made me SMILE”
Reviews.Author: Carmah411
Reviews.Content: I called to make a reservation for a get-away weekend, just to relax from work, and I invited some friends as well. When I made the phone call I was so undecided, but Victor was very pleasant, and patient. I know this is a busy season. I deal with customers all the time, so I know how they just need you to be there, and he was there for me. By the end of our conversation he was accomidating, i wasn't confused, and I was all smiles. Mind you this hotel was not my 1st choice, but with just that initial phone call it will be now. Thanks TCS

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience at CSLH.”
Reviews.Author: edelud
Reviews.Content: My stay started nicely at the bus stop where I first met Ronald who happened to work at the hotel. I had taken the train from Midway - used to live in Chicago, so, I can do that. Others may want to take a cab instead. I was pleasantly surprised upon entering the hotel and my room. Their rate was very reasonable and as such I expected a little less, however, I would ask they keep those rates. I initially booked for 2 days, wanting to be sure I liked the place and ended up staying all 4 days there. The business center was nice. The bathroom was nice and spacious along with the rest of the room. I took a room away from the train tracks for a little more quiet. As others have said, the internet was an issue my second day, however, I was offered another room if I wanted to move. Hopefully, they've laid that to rest. Overall, the staff (front desk - I believe Victor, bell hop and housekeeping) were all very professional, well intentioned and generally good during my stay. I enjoyed the hotel and would stay there again. Ronald was helpful on my second day with a special request I had.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service by front desk evening and night staff, especially Daniel.”
Reviews.Author: beachinnurse
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, clean and well kept. Front desk staff was very attentive, polite, and provided great customer service. Daniel really saved me by sending a cab to pick me up when I couldn't get a cab at the restaurant. I called the hotel because I didn't know what else to do and Daniel called me a cab (P.R. was the driver). I really appreciate his help and knowledge. Great hotel for business, the room was huge and floor was very quiet. Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations, great staff, great time!”
Reviews.Author: skywh0res
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the South Loop Hotel in Chicago. It was close to downtown without the downtown prices. Parking was free and plentiful! The rooms were more spacious than a regular hotel room and the prices were incredible. It was close to the expressway. The staff was more than willing to help with anything we need. One of the maintenance staff was especially helpful. Bernita was her name and everytime we saw her, she would ask if we were enjoying our stay and inquire if we needed anything. We are definitely staying here anytime we come to Chicago. The bar and grille had great food and reasonable drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: sandylaclair
Reviews.Content: I had a 3 day seminar at McCormick Place to attend. I drove down from Madison, WI and was able to park free at the hotel. I was just a 12 minute walk to McCormic Place or a $4.50 cab ride to that location. There were always other folks to ride with! The room was great and very quiet. I did loose my car keys the first night and I had my spair keys sent down so I could get home. The hotel found my keys, it had been snowing and sent them to me for free! Thank you Todd! The staff was very friendly and concerned about my keys. It was a short walk to my favorite restaurant in China Town, The China Garden. I will stay here again! Sandy

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, convenient, helpful, nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Lynne1112
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for the 2010 Radiological Society of North America (RSNA) Conference at McCormick. A colleague recommended I stay at Chicago South Loop Hotel because it was conveniently accessible to McCormick--Great recommendation. I was met by the beautiful and pleasant front desk receptionist-Jackie. I had to wait 'just a little bit' for my room to get ready but Jackie made it worth the small wait. The hotel was visually nice and comfortable and my room was clean and accommodating. The Fitness Center provided me with no excuses for starting out the morning with some cardio. Having a Business Center with free internet access was a plus. The little cafe in the hotel was a welcome stop so that I did not have to stand in the long lines at the McCormick food vending areas and the hot breakfast was nice. I did not get the name of the breakfast cook but he cooks up a 'great' breakfast sandwich. Chicago South Loop is a comfortable walk from China Town and I walked there for some great Chinese Food at 'Go 4 Food'. I felt very safe walking to and from China Town to the hotel but cabs are readily available. Free parking was another PLUS. I picked up a rental near McCormick at Hertz one evening and was pleased that I would not have to pay to park it at Chicago South Loop that night. All in all, if you are going to be in the McCormick area on business or for pleasure, I would recommend Chicago South Loop Hotel to you. -Lynne

Reviews.Title: “The Chicago South Loop Hotel is great!”
Reviews.Author: scschrimsher
Reviews.Content: The Chicago South Loop Hotel is great! Before we even arrived at the front door of the hotel, we were treated with excellent service. My employer was very impressed with Andrew, who works at the front desk. He gave us great directions to the hotel. When we arrived, Kyle opened the door for us and showed us to our rooms. He was also very helpful with restaurant selections. A man named Patrick Searles, who I believe helps out with maintenance, was also very helpful to me while I was there. I have never been to a hotel and found more friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience! The Bell-Man Kyle Thomas was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kiki53606
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago. It was a fun, enjoyable experience. My sister and I particularly appreciated the help and kindness of the Bell-Man there, Mr.Kyle Thomas! He assisted us in many ways and was courteous, informative and friendly. Your hotel should be grateful for an employee like Kyle! The hotel experience was wonderful. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Minimally acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Quebermuda
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just ok. It was quite far from downtown (to be expected for the price), but not a long walk to the subway which took us right downtown. We arrived at night and couldn't find anything nearby, it seemed quite isolated. In the morning, we realized it was close to Chinatown so we ate well after that. It's not particularly comfortable, but not uncomfortable either for the price. You could do better, you could do worse.

Reviews.Title: “Almost everything sucked”
Reviews.Author: likeswaterfalls
Reviews.Content: The service was horrible -- possibly the worst in a hotel I've ever experienced -- particularly by the folks who worked at the desk. To wit, I asked for a cab in 30 minutes and the guy working the desk told me to call back in 15 minutes to ask. And there was no one at the desk (i.e. not busy). My room had only tepid water. There was a ice machine at the other side of the wall that had the beds, so there was a constant hum and vibration. They advertise free coffee, but it ends at 730 am!! Crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: chrisclip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while celebrating my sister and my birthday. The hotel was extremely clean and nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Short cab ride to where we wanted to go. The rooms were well appointed and very large, with a very generous bathroom. The hotel was also very quiet and very comfortable. If you are going to stay in Chicago and don't want to spend the outrageous fees for the Magnificent Mile hotels, stay here and you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: acnoska
Reviews.Content: Everyone was incredibly helpful and friendly. Check in and check out were seamless! Service and food at the restaurant was great, and I had a cab within 2 minutes the next morning. The room was spacious, very clean, huge bathroom! If I would have been staying longer I definitely would have taken advantage of the gym. I really have no complaints about my stay, it was really an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and efficient”
Reviews.Author: smroney
Reviews.Content: Ni ce clean inexpensve hotel with Extremely friendly staff. If you are looking for reccommendations from the staff ask Kevin Rowe..........for all his reccommendations for food.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price... not great.”
Reviews.Author: GlookDaboo
Reviews.Content: The South Loop Hotel's location is great if you're attending a convention, but don't look for much else nearby. The hotel staff was friendly and the rooms weren't bad.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to McCormick Place”
Reviews.Author: rockystuff
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago for a convention and didn't want to spend hundreds of dollars a night for a room I would be using for 9 hours max a day. This place was clean, spacious, within walking distance to convention center, and had free gated parking as well. We arrived quite early, around 11AM, and they were able to get us into our room immediately. We stayed in a corner room (502 I think), which was a bigger room, and had windows on two sides. We could hear the L train rarely...it was not that loud. I think if we'd been on the other side of the hotel, we may have had a noisier experience. Another work companion was next door in 504, which was also a very big room. Our room came with an internet wire, but we'd also read the reviews in advance, so brought our own connector cable. Be prepared is one of my husband's mottos when it comes to traveling and accessing the internet. The area surrounding the hotel has some seedier-looking areas, but I was able to walk in daylight from the hotel to McCormick Place and felt very safe after I determined the safest route on day 1. (I had my husband as an escort that day, and our original path did not seem safe for a female alone). One evening I used the soda machine, and pushed the "diet" button, and got a regular pepsi. Thinking I was just tired and hit the wrong button, I went back to the room for another $1 bill (lots cheaper than your usual hotel soda machine) and tried again, making sure I hit the "diet" button. Again got the regular pepsi. So I took both cans down to the desk, got my $2 refund, and the desk clerk suggested going to the gift shop instead, since I'd be sure I did get the diet cola. However, when I went to the gift shop, their drinks were 20 oz bottles that cost $2 plus tax, and i only had my $2. I left the gift shop to head back to the elevator, and the desk clerk saw me empty handed. He asked why I didn't get my drink, and i explained that i didn't have enough for sales tax. He handed me a quarter, making me a very happy customer. I will return to this hotel next time that I go to a Chicago convention.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall, Internet an issue”
Reviews.Author: Palcolo
Reviews.Content: Accommodations are nice. Fairly new. Clean. Location is quiet. I was able to walk to McCormick Center for a convention without issue. I doubt this is a constant issue, but during my visit their in-room internet was not working. Each room is hard wired. Apparently they had a router issue. I'm sure the problem was fixed after my departure, but I had to go elsewhere to work. The location is quite removed from the hustle and bustle of downtown nightlife. If you want to be closer to the action, head north on Michigan Ave. For me, the quiet was welcome.

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay there again !”
Reviews.Author: MichaelandEdie
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay near the South Side - or just want to be out of the downtown hustle - this is the place. We stayed ten days for family affairs. The rooms were large, modern, clean and quiet. The staff were more than gracious and accommodating. And for all of this, the rates were very affordable. You are just across the street from public transportation. If you are going to be out and about in the city - the public transit pass is a must - very cheap and very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and value!”
Reviews.Author: TABWisconsin
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were wonderful with checking us in early, getting a taxi for us when needed, helping us decide which attractions to go to in which order, and answering all questions that we had. The business center was very user friendly (with free printing). We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant and is was very good. Free parking is HUGE in Chicago. We parked and took taxis the whole time. (Taxi cost was $9-12 to go to attractions. Very well worth it!) The room was very nice. We had 2 queen beds, loveseat and 2 chairs, and a desk and chair. The bathroom was large with a great vanity! Shower water pressure wasn't very good, but still got the job done! Overall.....a wonderful experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “The South Loop Hotel: Friendly, helpful staff and a clean place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: KRISinMICH
Reviews.Content: The South Loop Hotel is clean and a decent place to stay. I was a bit disappointed that they didn't offer at least a continental breakfast,and the cost was a bit steep considering the location(3 miles from downtown, and not in a safe area for a Mom to be walking with her kiddos). The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful-always greeting us with a smile, but it took security 1/2 hour to break up a drunken party in the room next to ours that had us up at midnight through 2 a.m. (also being awoken again at 3:30 by another intoxicated group at the entrance of the hotel...one was vomiting, one was taking his photo while the others cheered- was not my idea of decent night's sleep).

Reviews.Title: “Good value, out of the way”
Reviews.Author: dsteele2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend for a long weekend of sightseeing (4 nights). The room was large and clean. If you need complete quiet for sleep, the "L" might bother you, but i didn't have a problem. Having a parking lot just outside for FREE was a high selling point. Only 10-15 min. drive from downtown. If you need tips on things to do/places to eat, check out the touchscreen at the front desk. You can print out directions. Business center with printer was helpful, and free. Internet was down for a couple of hours early Saturday morning. No big deal - worked fine the rest of the time. Front office staff was friendly and helpful. Jackie was very nice and helpful at checkin. Same with Andrew at checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money - Location and Food could have been better”
Reviews.Author: entdoctor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was convinient as it was a walking distance from Mc Cormick convention centre,Chicago.The rooms were big clean and comfortable. Only thing was that it was a bit secluded from downtown chicago although you can get cab all the time. The room service and resturant needs a lot of improvement as it was not upto mark. They had fixed timings and if you are late then No Food. Well the resturant too was understaffed and does need more employees to take care of a smooth breakfast.All in all it was value for money hotel with not round the clock sevices. I would advise a round the clock cafe and bell desk and room service for improvement in the hotel facility but over alla nice stay though.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Marathon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff P
Reviews.Content: Good value, clean rooms, and just a quick bus ride on the #29 to downtown. Stayed here during the Chicago Marathon and myself and a whole bunch of other runners were able to catch the bus in the morning and get to the start line no problem. They even opened up the cafe extra early for us to grab breakfast. Will definitely be staying there again next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Free parking”
Reviews.Author: Barbie2653
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel though a little distance from the "action" of downtown. It was great to have free parking and we could catch a bus right across the street and coming back, it dropped us right in front of the hotel. Staff was friendly and the place was clean. Enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service in Chicago. A plesant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Minnie655
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very new and in good shape. The staff is VERY friendly and extremely helpful! Be sure to introduce yourself to Ronald on staff, as he will help you with any needs. A few of the rooms don't have internet hook-ups (it's local access, not wireless), and we were first placed in one of these rooms. However, when we asked the staff, they apologized profusely and upgraded us to a suite. All the rooms are huge. Free coffee and computer use in the business room. Also at the front desk is a guide to Chicago, where you can look up area activities, restaurants, and print off coupons for many attractions. Many cabbies and locals commented on how clean the hotel is compared to other hotels in downtown locations. You can really tell the staff cares about the establishment and wants guests to return. The one drawback of the hotel is that it is NOT within walking distance to downtown or the Navy Pier area. However, the bus stop is only a 5 minute walk-- hop on it and get off only 5-10 minutes later on Michigan Ave for $2/person. A taxi to Navy Pier runs about $10-15. The value of the place is well worth the extra travel expense.

Reviews.Title: “Professional Service”
Reviews.Author: graves42386
Reviews.Content: During my stay I reveived the most professional help from Kyle Thomas, one of your front desk/bellman. He offered my curtious service with several helpful hints in navagating Chicago, the hotle and the neighborhood. I was also impressed with Mr. Thomas when he made several upsell suggestions for an upcoming conference I will be planning next year. I think he is an assit to you organization and it was a pleasure doing business with him.

Reviews.Title: “Not for a business traveler and not in a safe neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: meigna
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business. I'm not sure who they're clientÃ¨le is supposed to be. They claim they're close to McCormick Place, so you would think it's geared towards the business traveler. However, they fail to tell you that no shuttle will take you to McCormick Place because this hotel is located in a very unsafe neighborhood on the south side of Chicago. The people who worked at the hotel were all very nice. And my hotel room was very clean. However, the first morning I woke up before having to work a tradeshow all day and I had to (a) iron my shirt on a towel on the floor -- no ironing board and (b) ended up buying instant coffee and using warm water out of the bathroom sink for my morning coffee ... and (c) no hairdryer in my room. So, I called the front desk to ask if they have ironing boards and hairdryers in this hotel. They replied, "Yes we do. They must have taken everything from your room." (Meaning, someone stole the hairdryer and ironing board). Needless to say, both items didn't make it to my room in time for the show. On 2 different occasions, both cab drivers asked me how I found this hotel and told me to stay inside and don't walk out on the streets because it wasn't safe. So, no coffeemaker in room, no ironing board, no hairdryer, can't take a shuttle to McCormick Place -- oh yeah, no restaurant associated with hotel - so no room service, and I can't walk around outside of the hotel for fear I might get taken out. Unfortunately, I can't recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Downtown Chicago, Clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: OneLoveJamaicaQC
Reviews.Content: This is a great little secret of the South Loop in Chicago. My husband and I have stayed there now a few times and have been very happy w/ each stay. It is close enough to downtown that it's a cheap cap fare. Also very close to museaums You DON'T have to vallet your car! Hotel decor very modern/classic w/ beautiful art that has a Chicago feel. Very clean. Only issue I have noticed on last 2 stays- the elevators occasionally have problems and are very slow. Other than that, really no complaints. Staff very helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “McCormick on business, or just need to be close in”
Reviews.Author: frankhurtte
Reviews.Content: I was amazed. When I travel to inner city Chicago, I am used to paying high prices, getting questionable service, and getting nailed for parking. A couple of weeks ago I stumbled onto this great hotel. First, it's in an area of town that just 5 years ago would be dangerous - but Chicago is changing - I felt 100% safe the whole time. This is a brand new building, a brand new hotel - great rooms, some of the friendliest service I have ever enjoyed. From Todd the manager on down, everone seemed to care about whether I was comfortable. Parking is free - and its right outside the door of the hotel not down the corner and around the block. The place is 6 blocks from McCormick West - I walked it a couple of time. Or a $4.00 cab ride - I got lazy one afternoon. It's walking distance to Chinatown (3 blocks). If there is a bad part its this - this is not a loop hotel. If you want to see the loop, do restaurants etc, you will probably need a cab or drive.
