However, with parking hovering at 30-40 dollars a night, the free parking will cover you cab ride. All in all, I am recommending this place to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is very helpful, the hotel clean”
Reviews.Author: Sister_Gert
Reviews.Content: Very close to McCormick Center in Chicago - price much more reasonable than chain hotels of similar quality (Hilton Garden Inn, etc). The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and generous in size. The hallways are quiet even with people in them - good walls. The EL runs outside, so you could ask for a room on the other side of the hotel but I didn't hear them once I was asleep. All in all, a very good valule!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff ... Especially Diane at the front desk!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LeCreole
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the South Loop Hotel for 4 nights (09/23-09/27) for a wedding weekend. At first I was a bit concerned that the hotel was not in the heart of downtown, but all of my concerns faded away as soon as I checked in! This is a hotel with such warmth and charm that starts from the minute you speak with the front desk (Diane at the front desk is phenomenal), and all the staff (I was on the elevator with the engineer who services and expects the elevators and we carried such wonderful and warm conversation!) One morning I came out of the room and was greeted by the housekeeping staff who were working on the other side of my floor. I spent almost 10 minutes laughing and appreciating their caring demeanor, concern if all was clean and satisfactory in my room, and answering my questions about going out and finding sites to see. Their information and concern was invaluable! :-) Since I had a car rental (there is free parking here) I had no problem getting around, but my cousin wanted to venture and travel on public transportation.Once again Diane at the front desk took the time to show all options and helpful tidbits that helped my cousin's adventure a joy! Diane is a real gem and is one of the reasons why I would come back! Lecreole@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Great price, decent location, amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: mh86
Reviews.Content: i was reading reviews for this hotel and was worried at how far everyone made it seem. in the city, you can get practically anywhere on the train, and cab rides are fairly cheap. we had a rental and were actually happy with the hotel being on the outskirts of downtown. the parking at the hotel is free and it's close to everything. the area is quieter, but not shady - it's right across the street from a hospital. the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and the service was great. it's not a luxury hotel, but it's clean, comfortable, and definitely worth the price. i highly recommend it if you're on a budget, have a rental, and don't mind staying 5 minutes (literally) outside of downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire Gives this Hotel 3 Stars: Very Misleading”
Reviews.Author: sophiaqueen
Reviews.Content: The South Loop Hotel is a perfectly acceptable place to stay, but do not be mislead by reviews that make it seem like a three star or luxury boutique. The location is not particularly close to public transit and cabs are sparse, so it's a bit out of the way. The walk to McCormick place is long, and not one that you'll want to make in the dark or bad weather. The beds are clearly second hand, both beds in my room sagged. The linens were OK. The room was very clean. The hotel was very, very loud - I was woken up by rowdy guests on my floor on both nights (weeknights!) of my stay. However, when I called the desk to report the noise, they responded promptly and politely.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, lacking frills but comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: MichaelACox
Reviews.Content: The staff are all very helpful. Victor and Patrick in particular went out of their way to help me when I arrived and in moving some boxes I'd had shipped to the hotel. The rooms are spacious and comfortable however there's a lot of external noise so bring ear plugs. A real grubmle is the breakfast as it's provided by a different company. It took 45 minutes to get breakfast, which whilst good food was way to long. The staff seemed more interested in looking after themselves frankly. I'd like it if they had coffee in the rooms too but overall i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Vilynn
Reviews.Content: I was a little leary of staying here but was pleaseantly surprised. It was clean, our room was large and service was adequate. It was a good deal and the free parking was a really nice bonus. It is South of "downtown" so if you want to do things in the that area be prepared to drive or take public transportation. It is near a hospital and train tracks so it isn't quiet but as a city dweller the noise outside didn't bother us. It was a bargin.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: cyevents
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Chicago South Loop Hotel three times in the last 9 month and will stay there again in November. I absolutely love everything about this hotel.I was born and raised in Chicago and this hotel is wonderfully situated in an area which is convenient to public transportation going in all directions, you can be in the shopping hub of downtown in about 15mins. I have never seen a more helpful staff, each time I have been there it has been consistent. I will continue to go there every-time I am in town and I have been there for business as well as leisure. I in fact have recommended them to my alumni association as the official hotel for our 40 year reunion next year.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for.............”
Reviews.Author: ProfHotelGuy
Reviews.Content: $91 including taxes from Hotwire. It isn't close to much but not too far from downtown. No room service, but delivery worked fine. Room wasn't spectacular but wasn't bad either. This is a no frills, good value hotel. I would consider staying here again if I'm in town for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and the price is great.”
Reviews.Author: Kbay2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and the staff is great. I did not like the food in the restaurant, however the owner made the necessary adjustments. This hotel location is the only draw back if you do not have a car. But I personally enjoyed my stay and would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Heather751
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not conveniently located to anything... downtown, restaurant, shopping. There is absolutely nothing walking distance and I wouldn't even think about venturing outside in this neighborhood after dark. It's very remote and not in a travel friendly part of town. It's not worth the free parking they offer which is why I thought I would try them. The walls in the room were filthy which was not a good first impression. There is a bar and a bakery and we recieved very slow and poor service at both. Also when checking out it took absolutely forever and there was only one person in front of us. I was not impressed at all with the hotel room itself, the service or the location. I will never book at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinaire, Professional and Courteous Customer Service Rendered!”
Reviews.Author: travelbrothermemphis
Reviews.Content: Victor Sims and Tommy Chen were the nice professionals who registered us at the front desk. After staying two nights, and recieving unsatisfactory service at the Comfort Inn on Ohio Street Downtown Chicago, we departed to find another place to lodge for our final night as visitors from Memphis, TN. After asking around, we were refered to you all, and we are greatful. We look to stay with you all on every visit to Chicago in the near future. Please let me know if you all have other hotels around the country. Kind Regards!

Reviews.Title: “Warning: The website is deceptive re location!!”
Reviews.Author: FMFM1984
Reviews.Content: Was very unimpressed. The website said "just minutes" from downtown but it's a lie - you have to take the bus, the train or a taxi ride to get anywhere remotely like "downtown". There is nothing around the hotel - not even a little breakfast place or cafe for some coffee. It's a very deserted and non-tourist friendly area. The staff were underwhelming, every time I went to the desk I waited about 5-10mins for service. There is a nightclub downstairs (again - not advertised on the website) and the walls are thin so if you're planning to get any sleep after about 11pm, good luck! Also, the place was pretty dirty and the 'breakfast' cafe on the ground floor was just awful - I would say middle-school cafeteria quality but that would be a compliment :(

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for the best price!!”
Reviews.Author: DangrousDave20
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! It had everything we needed for our two night stay. All of the staff down to the cashier at the bakery store were the nicest, most attentive I've ever seen at a hotel. Even the cleaning ladies all said good morning and hello as we walked by. This hotel has an awesome sports bar (hamburgers fries type joint), a really fancy dining place (wine and steak), a breakfast/bakery place (eggs, sausage, pancakes), and a convenience store all located on the first floor. As for the location (which is very negatively stereotyped), it was fine. It felt safe, and the hotel was especially safe. The parking is gated and a security guard patrols the area at night. Every morning and night we took the city bus for 2 bucks all the way downtown in about 5 mins no problem. Because of that, along with the price of the hotel and free parking, we saved about 100 dollars per night. Overall this hotel was great. I saw lots of families with kids, couples, and people by themselves stay here. The price was great. The service was great. This hotel is for anyone who is on a budget, but still wants to have a good time near the chicago downtown area. If you want to pay 50 dollars per night for parking plus 10 - 20 for everywhere else during the day, go ahead. I'll be staying here again on our next Chicago trip.

Reviews.Title: “I definitely would return......”
Reviews.Author: Maddye350
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and was helpful with my needs. My only complaint was that they gave me a handicapped room and did not inform me ahead of time. The handicap room was very no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Beautiful.....”
Reviews.Author: MsTexasTy
Reviews.Content: Starting with the outside decor on the way to the inside I was completely amazed. I as well arriived early and was able to check in..which is always a plus...Todd and Jackie then assisted me throughout my stay in a very friendly manor..all smiles and help from the both of them.... Once inside the room I was completely taken back...the large queens size beds...the spacious room...large clean bathroom..an Oh Yes..I fell in love with the bathtub..the room was so much more than I expected.. My 13 yr old son stayed with me as well and after one trip to the gift store..I know why he kept going..It was there I met Miss Mary..so warm and sweet..pleasant to talk to and took the time to talk to and educate my son about lif and importance of education...Not everyday do you find a complete stranger so interested in someone elses childs life...While I completely enjoyed my stay at the hotel..Meeting and talking with Miss Mary was the highlight of my stay..thanks Mary for being you and all that you do..God Bless....

Reviews.Title: “5 star service -- Econo Price!”
Reviews.Author: alyssium
Reviews.Content: Jacqueline & Leo at the front desk MADE my stay. They went above and beyond to make me the happiest traveller. I got there ahead of check out and asked to check my bags, they realized that there was actually a room available for me and let me head up straight away. The room was perfect. Every morning when i headed out for the day Jackie (sp?) was there to greet me and always happy and positive. When i asked for a late checkout she said it would be no problem. I work for a company that values legendary service and that is what i got from these two. One night in stark contrast, i asked for extra towels and was told to go down to housekeeping to get them myself. It was very different from the service i got in the day time. that is really my only complaint and that it is a bit far from the main parts of downtown... invest in a transit pass and you will be fine. As well Reggie's is a great place not far with good food and cheap brew.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: notdeconcentrate
Reviews.Content: I booked this room on hotwire.com. The front desk allowed us to check in earlier--they had planned to give us a King bed but had to give us a queen as it was all that was ready. Hotwire told me I was getting a queen, so that is what I was expecting anyway. The parking is free. However, if you use a debit card they hold $30 per night for incidentals. There is a bus stop right across the street, but my husband and I actually walked the 30 blocks to downtown and back. I wouldn't recommend it, but it is do-able. The hotel has a sports bar, a restaurant, a cafe, and a gift shop with snacks if you don't feel like leaving for meals. All of the staff was friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. I especially loved the bathtub. The only very minor negative was the train noise through the night. Overall, great for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT VALUE!”
Reviews.Author: Jules20102000
Reviews.Content: I was at first apprehensive about finding such a new hotel in Chicago at such a great price! I thought, what's the catch? With the help of Expedia, we paid $83/night for a 3 night stay. We had a spacious and clean room with 2 queen beds and spacious and very clean bathroom. We were on a tight budget, traveling from Georgia, to get my son off to college. So this seemed almost too good to be true, but it was good and true! $83 bucks/night!! A great deal for a nice and comfortable stay that didn't break me financially. It was just a 10 minute drive north on State St to get to the Moody Bible Institute campus for orientation, etc. Very convenient!! Also, one block away from catching the bus to go more into downtown Chicago to sightsee the next day! The staff was courteous and helpful in providing a map and suggestions for what to see, where to go. I appreciated their help as I work in a high volume tourist industry in Savannah, GA and do the very same for my city's guests as well. Good job!! The front desk staff was cheerful even though we didn't arrive until 10pm our 1st night. They were eager to help us with baggage at such a late hour! Very nice!! We will certainly use this hotel the next time we visit Chi Town and recommend it to others as well. It was a good stay for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel to Visit Chicago - Best price and good location”
Reviews.Author: josefgz
Reviews.Content: I came from Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico to Chicago driving my car. When I started to look for a hotel in Chicago most of the hotels were so expensive and de cheaper ones were to far away from chicago, nothing in the downtown of Chicago. Finally with expedia I found this beautiful hotel (Chicago South Loop Hotel) with the best prices and the best location. Close we found train station, bus stop and less than 10 from the Michigan lake. I got two bikes from Mexico, one to my wife and other for me, everyday I go to the beach in the downtown in my bike. The hotel allowed to me to have the bikes on my room and there is also a free parking for my car. Rooms are clean, wide. People of the reception desk are the best I have found in several trips. The building of the hotel is new, and this is very important I strongly recommend this nice hotel att., Fernando

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bang for the buck.”
Reviews.Author: rick_ccoleman
Reviews.Content: Excellent, friendly staff. We were in town for surgery on my wife at University of Chicago. Bell hop directed me to a secure, gated parking lot adjacent to the hotel. Rooms were clean and decorated nicely. We had to ask for a coffee pot. One of the cleaning girls got us one with the apology "Sorry for the inconvenience. People keep stealin' 'em." Overall, for the proximity to downtown, the museums, Wrigley Field and so on, this hotel is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “It's great to find a hotel jewel in Chicago that is affordable.”
Reviews.Author: twakhisi
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my sister at the Chicago South Loop and was instantly amazed by the hotel's decor, friendly staff and friendly fellow guests. The rooms are huge, the beds comfortable and the bathroom bigger than most you will find elsewhere. Our room was located on the State Street side where the L and buses and traffic whir by. But it didn't bother us at all. Parking is free. The business center was fantastic - FREE printing. The front desk professional and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, courteous, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: MOUSE129
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel. The staff was top notch. No matter what I needed, Kevin (the "bell boy") was there. He was so helpful. He gave me advice on places to go and things to do. His suggestions were great. He even helped me get in my car when I locked the keys in. Everyone was great. The room was awesome. I had a great view of the city. I will definitely stay there the next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “I want to keep the South Loop Hotel a secret.”
Reviews.Author: Hammer1968
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the South Loop Hotel. It was clean, affordable, close to downtown, and a very friendly staff! The only negative is I could hear the "L" ramble past in the middle of the night from time to time, but his will not deter me from future stays. I want to keep this place a secret so I can get a room in the future! Bottom line...I will be back and recommend it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay"”
Reviews.Author: Sidehackmary
Reviews.Content: The Chicago South Loop Hotel was the perfect location for an overnight stay for myself and my two teenage children. It was very easy to access off of I-94. Our destination, the Field Museum, was nearby and easy to drive to. This hotel was a GREAT value! With reasonable rates and free parking, I'll definitely stay there again. The service that the desk clerk, Victor, provided was excellent. Out room was super clean, newly decorated, and spacious. The neighborhood is in the process of being revived, so don't expect to do a walking tour. In fact, safety might be a factor, especially at night. The neighborhood does not offer restaurants and sightseeing, but has access to the city bus system. The hotel restaurant had just opened, and we found the ambiance and the food to be wonderful. I was delighted to find the Chicago South Loop Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “some nice advantages”
Reviews.Author: kliesemeyer
Reviews.Content: Free parking is great..free internet (except the wire for it is in a very odd place...behind the TV) Layout of the room is nice and spacious however you can't see the tv from the couch and seating area. You can't move the TV either..so that isn't an option. Room is farily quiet except for the bell hop blowing a whistle constantly in the evening hours for cabs. The train runs near by on the end of the building we were on, but not loud enough to keep you up. Front desk (Tom I believe) was very helpful..the others at the desk ignored us at the desk at check in and when stopped to ask a question..thankfully Tom was actually working. Give that man a raise!! I have complained, but the rooms are clean and the price is reasonable for Chicago and again free parking which almost impossible to find in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Clean Room but the Hotel Needs Some Upgrades”
Reviews.Author: lolavegas_06
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at this hotel, I actually had never heard of it. It is called the Chicago South Loop but there isn't much near the hotel. If one wanted to shop and eat out at a restaurant, a 10 minute bus ride is necessary. Luckily the bus stops right in front of the hotel and the EL is not far. The staff at this hotel is top notch. I received excellent service from the moment I checked in. The front desk was a pleasure, and any time that I called or made a stop at the front desk to ask a question or make a request, they were more than willing to help. That was a great first impression and made the stay pleasant. The room itself was pretty spacious and clean! The bathroom was spacious and clean as well! A clean room and bathroom is crucial to my comfort level at a hotel---well done South Loop! Also, there is a nice flat screen tv in the hotel room and the lobby looks great. I love the art work and its nice and big when you walk into the hotel. Now there is room for improvement, I understand that this is a young hotel so I'm not knocking it, I just want to give ideas for how the hotel stay can improve.... First issue---the bed is not the most comfortable. It is a little stiff and it takes some time to get used to and get cozy. I am not a fan of the mattress, if there is any way for the hotel management to improve that, I hope they do. Second----there was no HBO! The hotel has cable but no HBO channel, I have never been to a hotel without HBO so that was a shock to me. Please get the HBO channel. Third---there is no fridge in the room and no minibar. I know that this is a luxury complaint but if the hotel bills itself as a boutique hotel in the chicago south loop, there should at least be a fridge and minibar in the hotel room. Fourth---the business center only has 3 computers. Fair enough that there is free wi-fi in the hotel and you can hook-up a laptop in your room, but I think the business center can stand to have more than 3 computers. I think the hotel room decor can stand to have a few upgrades. It's not horrible by any means, it fine and its not drab. I just think with a good eye of a creative interior designer, the rooms can look just as good as the main lobby. I also saw what looked like slight water damage above one of the windows in my hotel room. Granted that this could have been due to some of the extremely intense and damaging thunderstorms Chicago has been experiencing this summer but I hope the hotel management will keep an eye on this. Overall, I had a decent stay. There were good things and things that needed improvement and I believe that overtime, these issues will be addressed. Once again, I must give props to the staff.....GREAT SERVICE and CLEAN ROOMS! That alone will give me a reason to book a room at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just an overall excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: dopimini648
Reviews.Content: one of the best rates that we found in the city. We were attending a concert at Soldier Field, and the South Loop Hotel was about 2 miles away. The staff was extremely nice and the rooms were nice and clean. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Just an overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Only the Basics”
Reviews.Author: EldestDaughter
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel: 3 computers in the Business Center, 6 machines in the Fitness Room, unsecured/complimentary parking,no "family friendly" resturants, but it is clean and appears to be fairly new. It is not within walking distance of any Chicago destination and it is in an area that is being redeveloped, so be prepared. If all you need is a a place to sleep,don't need to keep children/family occupied, and are willing to pay for parking at your destinations or ride the Chicago transit system, you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it...!”
Reviews.Author: Blkberi
Reviews.Content: I had read the prior reviews so I had high hopes. When we checked in the lines were long as they had 2 people at the front desk. I waited, no problem. When they finally checked us in & gave us the key we went up to the room and walked in on a shirtless guy sitting there smoking a cigarette! He was really nice & said hello & everything, of course we apologized & got out of there. As we were hightailing it back down to the front desk I said to my husband "I thought this was a no smoking hotel?" Bizarre. When we got to the front desk there was still a long line but we stood to the side & got the persons attention who checked us in. Jackie was really nice & apologized profusely. She figured out that the guest renewed his stay but that the computer system didn't update the info. So she thought the room was unoccupied. She was really nice & offered us a complimentary meal in the hotel restaurant. We thanked her & told her it wasn't her fault. She said the wait for another room would be 15-20 minutes as the maid had to clean it. Keep in mind the room was already paid for with the prior reservations I had made. So again we waited. She finally told us our room was ready & when I went to grab my bags my husband said he overheard Todd the general manager telling Jackie she needed to take our room back. I guess he needed it for someone else that had an issue as well & had been waiting. My husband said he gave him a look that could kill. Jackie told Todd that she couldn't take our room back because we were on our way up to it. Can you believe a general manager would say that though? We finally made it to our room after a long line waiting for the elevator. That was a major problem. It seemed like there was only 1 working elevator for the entire hotel, we tried to use another one we found but it wasn't working. Our room was decent, we were glad to finally be in it. The room was spacious, nice bathroom with a huge bathtub. There were brown crumbs or something underneath the sheet on the bed that I had to remove with a handful of Kleenex. We went out to dinner for our anniversary and when we came back the free parking lot was full. We finally found a spot on the street, luckily. The next day upon checkout we went looking for the hotel restaurant so we could use our meal vouchers Jackie gave us the day before, (to make up for the occupied room incident). We smelled the food but couldn't find the restaurant, there was no menu in our room for it by the way. After several passes thru the hotel & several people giving us directions we finally found it. The "restaurant" was really like a convenience store/ coffee shop the size of a newspaper stand with 4 stools in it. No wonder we couldn't find it. They were cooking on a hot plate. When we walked up we waited 10 minutes while no one acknowlegded us or said hello. When we finally placed our order & waited for our food, my husband & I couldn't wait to eat & get out of there. They told us there was an empty banquet room across the hall where we could wait for our food & they would bring it over to us. The waitress that brought our food was nice & cordial the food was ok. We hurriedly ate & left. Overall, we thought the hotel wasn't equipped to handle the volume of people that were there. The professionalism wasn't there for the most part. Jackie was professional & extremely nice but mostly everyone else was not. Starting at the top with Todd the general manager, perhaps that's the problem. I was disappointed by the whole experience. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. That was our first & last time staying there. Unfortunately Jackie's sweet personality can't carry the entire hotel. If you decide to stay there after this review you can't say you weren't warned.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in Chicago's south loop...this must be changed!”
Reviews.Author: ASI_Sandra
Reviews.Content: I was thoroughly pleased with the service and the quality of room that I got from staying at this hotel. Being from the south side of Chicago originally, I would have easily passed this hotel up because of the vacinity. The vacinity has changed for the best and this hotel gets my vote for cleanliness, friendly staff, value and the closenessof the location to the McCormick place was immeasurable. I am not one who would instantly agree to walk, but the distance to McCormick Place was silly to waist a cab ride or try to ride the CTA to get to it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and friendly & helpful staff, but a bit isolated”
Reviews.Author: av8r915
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in good condition and the rooms were nice and clean and we were fortunate enough to get a high-floor room with a nice panoramic view of the City. The staff was quite helpful and motivated to provide good customer service. My only (minor) complaints would be the hotel's relative isolation and lack of walking-distance amenities (restaurants, cafes, shopping, etc). In exchange for this isolation, you have easy access to the #29 bus which goes up State Street, through downtown and conveniently ends at the Navy Pier. We bought a 3-day CTA pass for $14 and it was a great value for seeing Chicago and getting to/from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The entire staff made my stay one to remember!”
Reviews.Author: Afi052
Reviews.Content: I had a need to stay at a hotel for an extended period of time during the months of May and June, 2010. While the circumstances surrounding my need to stay were difficult, the staff at the Chicago South Loop Hotel made my living experience an appreciated pleasure. The management (Travis and Todd) were warm and personable while remaining professional. The reservation/desk staff took the true meaning of customer service to a level I've not experienced often in this new age where speed trumps the old-fashioned model of extending one's self to provide the best of customer care. Thanks to Jacqueline, Tommy, Andrew, Shakara, and the others whose names I don't remember. The housekeeping staff were efficient and very careful, not disturbing my personal belongings while cleaning and tidying the living space. My room was the best in the hotel with a balcony door that opened to access the most gorgeous view of the Chicago skyline one could experience from a hotel room. Thanks Chicago South Loop Hotel for making my life comfortable and for putting a smile in my spirit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tdolbeare
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find, in a clean area. It was immaculate and beautifully decorated. We had a double queen room and the room and bathroom were very big. The staff was very friendly and helpful and remembered us each time they saw us. They also were helpful when we called for directions to get there, and then when we called from various place around the city to find out about the public transportation system. The business center was nice to use and free. Jacqueline, Tommy, and Travis were excellent staff at the front desk, and the service staff was always friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel stay ive ever had!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jessikag
Reviews.Content: i would just like to start this off with a very special thanks to andrew and todd.. from the moment i called to set up my reservation i could allready tell this was the right choice in hotel..i spoke with todd.. he was extremly helpfull and very friendly..i literally called everyday untill the day i arrived to make sure that things were in order and he was patient and nice through it all. as we arrived to chicago we had a little trouble finding the hotel. (i'm very nondirectional) and andrew (hotel clerk) helped us every step of the way. as we finally arrived at the hotel we were greated by andrew.after a friendly check in we went up to our room to get ready to hit the city and it was beautiful and amazingly clean.it was really nice to have a business desk in the room and still have space to walk around :). before heading to the city we literally asked andrew 100 questions about the city and places to go...and he answered them all and helped us find great things to do while visiting..with a smile on his face the whole time. what we found so neat about the hotel was the art that it had all around.and the amazing little cafe that we would go to every morning for breakfast and a quick snack.the people that worked there were super nice and understanding of my special dietary needs(diebetic). as it came around to our last day i finally got to meet todd face to face..he was just as nice in person as over the phone. he helped us find some places we were looking for before heading back home and doing so the whole time with a smile..everybody that works at that hotel treat you like theyve known you for years instead of just a travler.down to the maintnance man..he even helped us on our bus travels seein how we had to clue where to go and he took the same bus as we did..i'm actually planning another trip back to chicago and i am planning on staying once again at the chicago south loop hotel..i have traveld for many years and have stayed in hotels all over the whole eastern united states and the experience i had at this hotel is by far the best i have ever had..and i cannot waite to do it all over again soon..so thank you andrew and todd and everyone else that helped us.. jessica and donnie

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: BaseballfanMinden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Chicago for baseball games. I was really nervous about staying at a hotel that we weren't familiar with. But boy was I wrong. I booked this hotel through hotels.com. We were pleasantly surprised. Everyone was so helpful and pleasant. We had a wonderful stay at a reasonable price. It was a great trip and we will stay at the hotel again. The rooms were very nice and spacious. It was walking distance to Cellular Field and a short cab ride to Wrigley, Navy Pier, and the airport. It was perfect. The hotel was only 3 years old in an area that is building up. We couldn't have asked for anything nicer. Compliments to the staff and hotel management. You have diamond in the rough.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, walking distance to McCormick Place, and an easy cab ride to downtown sites.”
Reviews.Author: drpickard
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to BronzeTown, walking distance to McCormick Place (or a $7.00 cab ride, including tip),close to good restaurants and an easy walk to Chinatown. The staff are friendly and accommodating (We were especially appreciative of Kyle who answered all our questions and provided excellent directions and suggestions for eating out). It is not the Hyatt or Marriott, but if you come to Chicago for a conference, business or just to explore the city, it is a reasonable --and less costly alternative to the other more well known hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, but very lacking in services and amentities, not worth price.”
Reviews.Author: jemikcmo
Reviews.Content: - Need Coffee pots in room. -Mattress was very hard and uncomfortable. -No Restaurant or Room Service. -Air Conditioner was noisey and inadequate coverage. -Need microwaves in room or more in hotel. -Need refrigerators in room.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, location and free parking!”
Reviews.Author: KLG1968
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for location! It was close to Chinatown and only a short drive to Downtown. Very clean rooms, friendly staff and 24-hour access to a computer (which came in handy!). I would have liked a small refrigerator in the room (for my leftovers), but I was able to make due. Also, the soda vending machine gave me root beer no matter what choice I made! Overall, if you're visiting the Southside, Chinatown, Hyde Park area, then Chicago South Loop Hotel is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value --- BEWARE OF LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: curdeb
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good value on a hotel for your Chicago visit then the South Loop will certainly fit your budget. The price was right and it's hard to find a hotel in Chicago that has free parking. But it comes with a lot of other "negatives" that you should be aware of before booking. The hotel is what I would call "average". The staff was fine and the rooms were adequate. But room cleanliness was a concern of ours. The bathroom was very clean and new but the room itself and furniture were old. Room also had a bit of a musty ordor. Hard to sleep due to the very noisy AC unit as well as the numerous sirens that you heard all night due to the close proximity to a hospital. Our room was also on the side of the hotel nearest the train tracks which was also very noisy every time a train went by. Location is the biggest problem with this hotel. It is located about 30 minutes by bus or cab from the heart of downtown Chicago. And the neighborhood it is in, as we later found out from some cab drivers we had, is one of the worst in Chicago. One of our cab dirvers told us he never comes out to the hotel unless he has someone like us going to the hotel from downtown. We were also warned numerous times by cab drivers to not walk around the neighborhood, especially at night. It is in an area that has a lot of low income housing (ie projects) and many vacant and boarded up buildings. Although the hotel staff said it was safe to walk to the train station I certainly would not. Your are almost forced to take a cabe or use the bus which stops on the corner -- but be sure to use cabs at night. While the hotel says they have a deli it is pretty sad. Poor food and poor service. They were using 2 coleman gas stoves to cook eggs and had a hot plate and gridle for pancakes. Also almost no place to sit so you are forced to bring anything you purchase back to your room. You are stuck if you are hungry in the AM for somethin to eat as there is nothing else in the neighborhood. Even if there was you probably would not want to walk there for the reasons previously mentioned. As I said, a good bargin for your dollar given the cost of hotels in Chicago but be sure to evaluate the location and other safety issues you need to consider. We'll pay the etra $$ on our next visit to Chicago and avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I feel the need to warn you.”
Reviews.Author: LeaBNewYork
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me mention that I travel often for business and this is the first time I've ever felt strongly enough about a hotel to actually take the time to review it. This place is not what they advertise it to be. They call themselves a "boutique hotel." It's not. The rooms and service are the equivalent of any crappy two-star hotel. But that is not the biggest problem. The biggest problem is the location. In short, it is not safe. The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk from the Chinatown L stop. The area around Chinatown is bustling and colorful and definitely worth exploring. BUT, the hotel is not in Chinatown. As soon as you walk one block from the L towards the hotel, you are in a run-down, ghetto. And it doesn't just look unsafe. It IS unsafe. A man followed me as I walked from the L to the hotel around the corner of State and 23rd St. When I let him pass in front of me, he waited at a bus stop until I passed and then continued to follow me. When I turned to face him to acknowledge that he was following me, he insisted on "walking with me." I got on my cell phone with my boyfriend but that did not deter him. I started to get nervous as we were getting further away from any other people. That's when I hailed a cab to the hotel. There are a lot of people just "hanging out" on that corner (which is a bunch of boarded up store fronts and an empty lot) and once you turn on to State, you have a 10 minute walk down a pretty empty street until you get to the hotel. It's a perfect situation for someone to get raped or mugged. That's the worst of it, but that's only the beginning...I'll try to sum up the rest. Service is not exactly rude...more like sedated...It took the guy at the counter over 10 minutes to check me in while a line formed behind me b/c he couldn't find my reservation and although there were other people hanging out behind the counter, they were not helping him...or anyone else. There is no restaurant at (or near) the hotel and also no refrigerators in the room, so dining in is challenging. I brought some food back from Chinatown but had to fill a bucket with ice to keep it cold. The vending machines on several floors had no water left in them...to get drinking water I had to go to the water cooler in their "state-of-the-art" fitness room (it's not state-of-the-art). In short, this place is ghetto trying to sell itself as chic. From the disgruntled looks I noticed on the faces of other guests, I assume I'm not the only one that was deceived by the website and expected something completely different for the price. The one positive thing I can say is that the bathtub in my room was huge, which was a nice way to decompress after an unpleasant evening spent here at Chicago South Loop Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel Great for the Price and Location to the Mc Cormick Place.”
Reviews.Author: blade2dabone
Reviews.Content: We attended a Conferance at the Mc Cormick's place, the hotel's location was good for the Visit. It was clean the staff was friendly the Bellboys were always in the loby, avalible to assist with information, cabs ect. The front desk allways ready to help even the handy man we saw. The house keeper was horrible and either missed cleaning our room or did so inadequately . The smal personal cafe as well as the bar as a good touch. The hotel is about a 1/2 mile's walk from China Town and the 'L' the elivated train, the buss a few blocks away can take you down town, the Metra at c Cormick's Place as well. Overall we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Birthday in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Mike4cFortLauderdale
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip with my 2 sisters for a week in Chicago. Having stayed at the South Loop Hotel for the Chicago Marathon I decided to stay again. The large rooms and with a good sized bath were part of the reason. This hotel offers free parking, and is close to city transportation. Very clean and quite with friendly staff, a great deli and new restaurant on site. My sisters and my self enjoyed our stay and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “one night of unquieted”
Reviews.Author: misty4392
Reviews.Content: I had a nice room and everything was going fine until 11:00pm when a couple a man and a woman. Her husand must have been drunk and they was fighting and slamming doors i call the front desk and securtiy came stay stop for a while and stay startrd up again and she came out of her room asking for help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Conf @ McCormick Place”
Reviews.Author: Peffredgrowl
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the price, proximity to the McCormick place were I was attending a conference, and generally favorable ratings. Not familiar with Chicago, I was concerned about the location's safety. The hotel was clean, the bed was very comfortable, and I slept very well all 4 nights I was there. It's an easy walk to the Convention Center, and I had no safety concerns (as a woman traveling alone). My only complaint is the same as others ... no in-room coffee! There is a very small family style cafe onsite for breakfast and lunch items, but no adjacent restaurants or coffee shops. The price was great -- I would stay here if I attend another conference in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Lipstick on a pig”
Reviews.Author: blakesmom911
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty gross. When you first walk into the hotel, things look ok, but don't look too close...it's a dirty little mess. There is no doorman, no security and nobody to welcome you when you come in. the front desk staff were not rude but they certaintly were not friendly! They were just ...'there' and at times seemed annoyed to be there. The neighborhood is not safe at all, which normally wouldn't be bad, but this hotel has no security and nobody who stands up front! The doors are left unlock in the front and sometimes the side so people can wander in and out from the streets if they wanted too. The rooms are ok but they just have that lipstick on a pig feel. Nothing high quality. there is no place to eat there either, no room service, and no resturant. There is a bar that has bad food but good service! The workers in the bar were the friendliness. In the hotels defense, they DO have a nice lobby! But if your not planning on sleeping in it.....I would skip this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Blend Of Economy And Style”
Reviews.Author: vigsom
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago and I booked here after checking them out on the net. Arriving at a new City/Hotel after close to 24 hrs of travel,I was wary.But the hotel was "Love At First Sight". Friendly staff,quick check in,great super clean rooms set the tone for a good four days stay. While there is no restaurant attached(there is only a cafe which works 0730-1930 hrs),there are places to order stuff from and have it delivered - Sarpino's,Connie's,Go4Food and many more. All that they show on the website is real-in fact the hotel looks way better when seen real time than in photos. Just 10-15 minutes walk from McCormick West.Cabs can be called immediately.The cta bus is available just round the corner.There is a metra train station also closeby. A great place strongly recommended to mid-budget travellers. Would only request the hotel to provide a kettle so that one can have coffee at one's convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, spacious place to stay while visiting Chicago”
Reviews.Author: DennisOB
Reviews.Content: Overall: The difference between a good Hotel and a great hotel are the little things. This Hotel is better than what it's price and location may indicate. South Loop is a very good hotel and very new, I think. Good: The rooms are very generous, clean and well serviced. The staff, service, conditions were well above expectation. The location is a little isolated, not much locally, but close to CBD, there is a bus at the door, train 10 minute walk plus many taxi's. Not so good: Lack of security boxes in the room or at reception; No availability of CTA cards for easy public transport use; no in-house laundry services and the recommended out-service is expensive. (There are good cheaper laundry's in 36th street) No apparent cafe or light meal/refreshment facilities. The bar gets a little hectic and loud. This place has great potential, I would/have recommended it to my business colleagues mand certainly would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and relaxing stay with our family”
Reviews.Author: Lilac56
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say what a comfortable and relaxing stay my family had at the hotel while preparing for my brother's funeral. The hotel staff, the room, even the beautiful decor of the South Loop Hotel, made our stay relaxing and comfortable. To know upon our return to our hotel room, after the funeral services, gave our family a relaxing feeling just like returning home. We will stay there again. The Fair-Price Family

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel with customer service professional staff associates”
Reviews.Author: Libra1980
Reviews.Content: I did a vacation stay on my first trip to Chicago and had a wonderful experience. I stayed Friday - Monday and my room was clean, roomy and included a spa bathtub. The hotel staff was prompt and courteous. The hotel is within minutes of the Navy Pier, McCormick Place, Downtown and Chinatown. I didn't hear any other guests and my visitor had free parking, a rare amenity for that area. I was also escorted by a front desk rep named Tommy to Ricobene's to cure my hunger. My warmest thanks to all of the staff I encountered at this hotel and I will definitely stay there again upon my return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “"Great time in an awesome city"”
Reviews.Author: pmeier16
Reviews.Content: Rates for the trip where very reasonable. The staff was knowledgeable and generous with insider information on the city. The rooms where very nice. It was a trip that will never be forgotten or recreated.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Helpful Front Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: melcaylo
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a group of six of my colleagues. We were booked into three rooms, which were reserved for us by our finance manager. Five were scheduled to check in on a Monday, one was to join us on Thursday, and the last person was to arrive on Friday. In addition, our finance manager booked all the rooms under her name, didn't give the hotel any of our names, and also forgot to fax them the credit card authorization form. Our arrival and stay had the potential to be disastrous. But it wasn't. I want to single out TOMMY, who works at the front desk. He is smart, understanding, helpful, patient and above all, courteous. We were able to check in after one of us put our credit card down, and he explained he wouldn't place a hold on the card and he'd wait until our finance manager faxed in the completed authorization form, which she didn't do until Saturday! (We stayed until the following Monday.) When the seventh member of our group arrived on Friday, he was mistakenly placed in one of the two rooms we had already, and when I went down to explain to Tommy that we were supposed to get a third room, he understood and checked him in with no hesitation, even though our finance manager hadn't yet sent in the authorization form. While the South Loop Hotel is not a five star establishment, I have to commend Tommy for making it feel like it was.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: rette4
Reviews.Content: The front desk employee was very friendly and helpful even though he was busy. For the price, the room was very nice and clean. Close to the train and bus lines. Only thing I would change would be to put a coffee pot in each room. Other than that, everything was top notch. Also, free parking right next to the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago's Best Kept Secret!”
Reviews.Author: busterscutie
Reviews.Content: My family booked our room on the day of arrival and received a great rate compared to the other major hotel in the area. We knew it would be a neighborhood hotel, rather than the 5 star high rises a little further north, but were overall pleased. The rooms featured a two chair and table sitting area, a flat screen television, and basic bathroom amenities. The hotel offered free parking, a tremendous savings in this area, and is immediately near the State Street bus stop for easy access 20 blocks downtown. We also enjoyed the homemade breakfast prepared by the manager of the on site cafe. The beds were a little hard but the stay was well worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms!”
Reviews.Author: mharmonLouisville
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 1 night in downtown Chicago but decided to leave the downtown area because of the 40.00 a night parking fees. The South Loop is located just south of Soldier Field, Shedd Aquarium, and Adler Planetarium and the parking is free! The hotel was very clean, the rooms huge and relaxing, and the staff friendly and helpful. The hotel does not provide free breakfast nor did I see somewhere to eat within walking distance. Something that was provided at other hotels in this price range. The hotel is not located within walking distance of anything so you do need some type of transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an out of the way spot”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelBoston
Reviews.Content: I booked the South Loop Hotel to attend a White Sox game at US Cellular field. It's the closest hotel to the park. For those of you who don't know Chicago, the South side is not the best. The hotel is next to train tracks, near two freeways, on the edge of Chinatown. But, the building is new, the lobby is nice, the desk service is fantastic (they actually have enough staff to help you), the room was big and the bed was great. For under $100 on Travelocity, it was a steal! Turns out you can walk to the park (1.3 miles), but you have to walk due West past LaSalle first to get to a decent neighborhood. Then turn South and follow the lights. This is a great find, as long as you drive or don't mind a safe buy rough edged neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently-located, well-priced hotel, with in/out parking included.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyB2
Reviews.Content: We'd highly recommend this hotel for its convenient location, reasonable price, clean spacious rooms, friendly staff. There was no additional charge for parking in the fenced lot adjacent to the hotel, and we could take our car in and out at will. Check out was simply calling the front desk and telling them that we were leaving the key in the room.

Reviews.Title: “not recomendeble”
Reviews.Author: qadis3322
Reviews.Content: Located in bad neighborhood, no restaurants in walking distanste, front desk very slow and not very helpfull. Breakfast is a joke, the complementary coffee in the morning was cold and heated up for me in the microwave. Veding machines were empty my whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel service I have experienced in a long time”
Reviews.Author: globalgal68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stylish, clean and very service oriented. One evening we had difficulty with our door keycard and Patrick went out of his way to assist us. The hotel is quiet and the rooms are large and roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Predictably good - like always”
Reviews.Author: NanciAnne
Reviews.Content: We've been staying here for about 2 years now when making quarterly trips to Chgo. While it's just south of Chicago's main Downtown (The Loop) the location is good. Right near public transit and the self-parking is free. The rooms are spacious, with a European soaking tub. Our room had a fridge, too. We enjoyed the view. Only two things were lacking: restaurants within walking distance and they couldn't clean the room until afternoon because of being at 100% occupancy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and very good value. Location is the only trade-off.”
Reviews.Author: AntonioShanghai
Reviews.Content: I's staying in the Chicago South Loop Hotel as I write. i) Let's start with the only negative aspect: The hotel is in a "desolate" neighborhood, despite being quite close to downtown. There are no bars / restaurants in the close vicinity of the hotel, except for a very basic cafeteria on the premises (no sitting, you have to take your food to your room or the common spaces). Only other on-site option is delivery. There's a decent pizza place that does the trick in 20 min or so, but you have to take your stuff from reception. Driving or a cab is required to get to / fro. I've not tested the safety of the neighborhood, but I'd be concerned to leave the hotel on my own at night, walking on the streets. I visit Chicago every few years, so I'm not an expert on this city, but that's the way it feels. ii) Everything else is VERY positive. Big room, comfy beds, big flat screen TV, nice bathroom, free parking, free fast internet. The Front Desk Team is very good and motivated. I checked in very late (2am) and the lady was all smiles. She called me when I was in my room (2' after I had got there) to check if everything was OK, which was. Only glitch was the absence of wi-fi signal in my room (corner room, away from elevator), but there's an Ethernet cable connection in the room too. Hotel is very close to Mc Cormick Place, which was why I was visiting Chicago, so it's convenient and uncrowded in the morning to get there. ii)

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and great guest service!”
Reviews.Author: ATFLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chicago Southloop for a conference I had over the weekend. The hotel was gorgeous, considering I had a good deal on the room through hotels.com. I expected less because I had a steal on prices but Southloop exceeded my expectations by far. The hotel lobby is gorgeous and the guest service was quick and easy. Actually, I was approached by one of the front desk workers and she gave us a coffee maker. I didn't expect that at all also because again, I felt like I paid a fairly cheap price for such great service. Needless to say, I really enjoyed the service from the South Loop employees. They were pleasant and quite helpful with anything I needed. As for the rooms, they were very spacious. It was very clean and smelled pleasant (some hotels have that stench of dirty laundry...definitely not South Loop). The bathroom was also another plus because it was a rather large bathtub that could easily fit two people. It was definitely a 5 star hotel accommodation for a very affordable price. Also, the greatest part of it all was that they have a business center down stairs equipped with 3 computers, a printer, and a huge copy machine. I found this soooo helpful as I needed to print out my reservation for my flight. It was all free, as long as you had a key for your room--you're able to access the business center. The only downside is that it's a not situated in a place that's close to dining restaurants and such but you can definitely catch a cab for fairly cheap. That's the only thing I can say that's lacking but other than that, I loved that I didn't have to pay for parking and wi-fi was free. I stayed at another hotel in town and it was quite expensive (room & parking) and I had to pay for wi-fi. I definitely missed the South Loop for the perks they offered there but overall, I had a great experience! Checking in and out was so quick and I had no problems at all with guest services. I absolutely recommend this hotel! Definitely a lot of bang for your buck, which is tough to find in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheatreloverFlorida
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were traveling to Chicago from Florida for a play at The Goodman Theatre. We decided to make a week out of it and booked a great package through Travelocity. We had never been to Chicago before, so we were a bit clueless when it came to maneuvering the public transit system (we drive everywhere in Florida) We didn't want to rent a car because quite frankly we were scared to drive in snow and ice. We should have done a bit more research on this aspect on the trip, because we ended up taking the L into downtown, then were told to transfer onto a bus â€“ a bus going in opposite direction of where we told them we needed to go â€“ so we promptly got off that busâ€¦and realized that we were on the corner of Urine and Crime Spree. With 2 suitcases each. In 20 degree weather. Did I mention weâ€™re from Florida? So, yeah. That was a fun walk to a questionable gas station/daytime hooker depot. We called a cab and when we told him where we were going, he was surprised there was even a hotel in that neighborhood. We were getting a little nervous. The cab driver then launched into a tirade on how dangerous a neighborhood it was and how we should make sure we didnâ€™t walk anywhere and ALWAYS take a cab. And of course, he gave us his card so we could call him back for rides. He dropped us at the hotel and we were relieved to see that it was quite lovely from the outside and beautiful on the inside. The staff that greeted us were so helpful and reassuring. We told them about our trip in and they apologized repeatedly and assured us that the neighborhood was NOT at ALL like the cab driver made it out to be, and the Mayor lived 3 blocks away. We were also pleased to discover that there was a bus stop right outside the door that went straight into downtown all the way to The Navy Pier. The bus ride only takes about 20 minutes. It cost $2.25 per person each way and you need exact change. (quick tip, if youâ€™re staying in the city for more than just a couple of days and you plan on using CTA, you may want to consider getting a bus passâ€¦it will save you some $$ in the long run) We were very pleased with our room. First of all, it was HUGE with a big flat screen TV. It even had a separate sitting area. The bathroom was great with a GIGANTIC soaking tub with endless amounts of hot water. This was definitely a welcome feature after a long day of sightseeing in the freezing temps. It also had free wireless internet which was a huge plus. The staff was extremely nice and very helpful. Especially Todd at the front desk. He was very helpful in assisting us with restaurant suggestions and points of interest in the city. There is a little cafÃ© downstairs that served breakfast, lunch and dinner. They will even deliver to your room for a $3 surcharge. The food is delicious and it was great to get coffee and OJ first thing in the morning without having to leave the room. The only things I would change about the hotel is the fact that there wasnâ€™t a little kitchenette setup; i.e. mini fridge, microwave or coffeemaker. There is certainly room for it in the sitting area. Since we were staying for 6 days, and frequently ordered out, we found ourselves loosing any food we couldnâ€™t finish due to there being nowhere to keep it cold. Also, there are no snack vending machines which was a little unfortunate since there really are no convenience stores close by. There were 2 soda machines on each floor, but on two separate occasions we went to every single one to find them all completely sold out. Iâ€™m stating this not so much as a complaint but more to allow a potential guest to prepare and make sure they stock up when the cafÃ© is open ï�Š All in all a fantastic experience at a fantastic hotel, and that will definitely be our hotel of choice on our next trip to The Windy City!

Reviews.Title: “WOW waht a great lcoation and value”
Reviews.Author: pierceall
Reviews.Content: Recently I had the pleasure to book nights at the South Loop Hotel in Chicago, Illinois Upon arrival the agent Leo and care staff Patrick were personable, stellar and helpfull. The hotel has great open parking and accessibility. The rooms are spacious and basic, what you need for sleeping. I would without question stay here again. It is just a few blocks south of McCormick place and easy, brand new and a value. Greg Pierceall Landscape Architect and Professor

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat this place for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Db1105
Reviews.Content: Found this place close to the IIT campus. For the price, this place can't be beat. The staff was friendly at both check in and check out. We had a corner room which was cold. They need another heater in there and better windows. It didn't bother me because I like to sleep in a cooler room. The room was huge. It had a nice flat screen tv. The bathroom was also large. It had a bathtub with shower. The tub was big. The shower was strong with some nice hot water. There is a small deli at the hotel. The coffee is decent enough. I ordred a bacon, egg , and cheese on an everything bagel. It was very good. Good bacon which they did not scrimp on. They have pancakes and waffles also. The only thing I didn't like was the 11am checkout. We checked in late after a long drive from having our flight cancelled from the east coast. Overall, for a hotel in a major city, close to everything, this place is a gem

Reviews.Title: “Getting More Than Just a Smile”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelingGurl
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Chicago and I must admit, i was a little nervous about visiting a city i knew nothing about and booking a hotel per a friend's suggestion off of expedia.com. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the hotel far exceeded the good expectations i already had. The rooms were spacious and clean and the lobby well decorated with a hip, urban feel to it. The only challenge we encountered was a broken ethernet cord in our room, which was resolved quickly and with some of the best customer service I have experienced. The staff, Leo and Pat, proved to not only be incredibly helpful and pleasant while they assisted us, but genuinely cared about our stay at the hotel. Their commitment to good customer service went far beyond a warm smile. They offered assistances and we needed to switch room, they offered suggestions to enjoy ourselves, and tips for navigating the city. All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely accomadating and great hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: cordescharity
Reviews.Content: Everyone was so nice and pleasant right down to the cleaning staff! The free parking was a great plus especially in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Comfy Place At All”
Reviews.Author: houstonguy2010
Reviews.Content: Got this on Hotwire at a good rate. Listed as a 3 star hotel by Hotwire. I personally think that this is a glorified Motel 6! Away from most everything. Difficult to obtain a cab here. Plain barren rooms. A nice flat screen TV though. No restaurant on premises. No room service. No wireless internet, but they do have hard wired internet. I ordered pizza and had to go to the lobby to get it. That is not a nice touch when you cannot even provide me with a restaurant. The bed was very hard. I nice pillow top would be nice. The hallways were cold. I would not stay here again if I have a choice. This should be listed as a 2 star max.

Reviews.Title: “"The Greatest Hotel Ever"”
Reviews.Author: ladyl45
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel was very wonderful. I really enjoyed myself,the staff was terrific. There is nothing bad I can say about the hotel. Look forward to visiting the hotel again. Thank You! Freddie Cook

Reviews.Title: “WEEKEND GETAWAY”
Reviews.Author: smithlak30
Reviews.Content: So the girls and I decided at the last minute to book a room at the Chicago South Loop for the Valentine's Weekend. It was great and service was excellent. It is located blocks away from the Mccormick Place and downtown Chicago. The rooms are inviting with a sitting area for two, internet usage and flat screen tv. The best was the relaxing feel of the oversized bathtub. We loved it and will lodge there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: HospitalPatient
Reviews.Content: We recently needed a hotel near the University of Chicago Hospital. The hospital recommended the South Loop Hotel. It was onlay a 15-minute drive from the hospital. We couldn't have been more satisfied. The rate was very reasonable, and the hotel had clean, roomy, and comfortable rooms plus good food available. I used the fitness center and had a drink in the lounge. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The parking was free, which is very unusual for this area. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Made us feel at home”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueen29
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks during the holiday season. On a personal note, we wanted to stay somewhere not far from home as we were having some work done on our apartment, which happened to run into the holiday period. So we wanted to be somewhere whereby we could celebrate the season, but not feel like we were displaced. We shared a little bit of this information with the staff and to our surprise, they went above and beyond our expectations to make us feel right at home. At times, we felt like "celebrities" because of the star treatment. My family and I will never forget this experience and are indebted to the staff for the kindness that they extended to us in making us feel welcomed. I want to especially thank Leo at the front desk for his professionalism, as well as being personable in handling our reservations and seeing to it that we were well taken care and that all of our needs were met, and also Kyle who was always extremely courteous and helpful. We enjoyed our spacious room, which was always very well maintained during our 2 week stay. The location of the hotel was also very convenient, as you can take just one bus downtown (if you prefer not to drive) and get there in 10 minutes. Because of our excellent experience during this stay, we know that we will be back and I'd recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “TODD SOLIDAY was so amazing He helped me and my son with everything”
Reviews.Author: asdhlee
Reviews.Content: Todd and Kyle were so nice. The room was SO BIG you could have fit 3 queen size beds easy.It was so clean .flat screen tv.TRANSPORTATION IS RIGHT OUTSIDE THE HOTEL.I have already told all my friends.The PRICE CANT BE BEAT. STAY THERE TOM AND ZAK ERIE PA.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to U of C Med Center”
Reviews.Author: randdmack
Reviews.Content: My wife was scheduled for surgery at U of C, so I wanted a hotel close by. For past hospitalizations, I had stayed at a downtown hotel, which was not as convenient, and parking was expensive. South Loop Hotel was a very pleasant surprise and only four miles from the hospital (and you don't need to get on a freeway to get there!). Modern, clean, well appointed. Odd that there was no coffee pot, remote control or Gideon's Bilble in the room, but I was there to sleep! I will stay here again the next time we have to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasAmtraker
Reviews.Content: We had to go to Chicago because our son, who goes to college in the area, was having surgery. We didn't know when exactly we would be able to leave, but the staff was SUPER nice, and SUPER accommodating. So, GREAT staff - that's EVERYONE we dealt with, the hotel is nice and clean. The beds are big and comfortable. The rate was very reasonable. The hotel inside and out is quiet. Parking is onsite and FREE. And it's a short drive right up State Street to get to the downtown area. I don't know what else to say except whenever we need to be in Chicago, this is where we're going to stay! On the other hand, if this review is going to make the place so crowded that I can't get a room, forget everything I said!

Reviews.Title: “The one good thing in the South Loop....”
Reviews.Author: SummerOhio
Reviews.Content: The one thing we enjoyed about this hotel was the Bellman Kevin...Wow! What a good worker! He was fast, efficient, and johhny -on- the- spot personality. So willing to help compared to any staff we encountered!! He took us to our room, got us cabs and was so very, very efficient. Thank you Kevin!! This hotel lacks ambience, rooms are cheaply done, no restaurant, only a coffee shop with horrid coffee and unfriendly workers!...oh, there is a bar there too, but that appears to be a dead beat place; basically: spend your money some place else!! It served our purposes for a wedding, but next time around we plan to find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Find a different hotel, that won't steal from you!!”
Reviews.Author: Abfc23
Reviews.Content: We were happy with things at first and had left the hotel leaving money hidden behind. When we returned the money was gone. Called and talked to GM, and he said that he would look into it and never heard from him again. We called and left several messages and never recieved a call back. Do you're self a favor and find a trust worthy hotel! One that doesn't steal from you and then ignore you're concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What We Needed”
Reviews.Author: Imagetrend
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we needed. We were on a business trip to a conference that was being held at the McCormick Place which is walking distance. The rooms were big, clean and comfortable. The service that we received from the staff was great. This is not a fancy downtown hotel, but for the price it is perfect for a Business Trip to Downtown Chicago. The only complaint was that the room took several hours to heat up. Other than that it was great. Todd & Andrew were great at the front desk. Kyle the bellman provided the ultimate customer service by chasing down a cab that I left my cell phone in. He ran the cab down two blocks away, got in the cab and had the cabbie come back to the hotel. Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with best staff ever”
Reviews.Author: AnetNeil
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights - wish it had been longer. The staff cannot be beat - very helpful, friendly, really cared about their guests. If I owned a hotel, I would steal them, starting with Todd - what a great guy! We took the bus into downtown, it was easy - we walked to McCormick Plaza and it took about 15 minutes and was very easy. We walked to Connie's restaurant which was wonderful and again a very easy walk. We asked Todd for a room with a view of the city lights and he moved us to a room on the 4th floor that had a view we will remember forever. If we return to Chicago we will stay there again. Only request would be coffee pots in the room, or at least in the lobby. The small cafe had a very nice man, but it would be nice to be able to just have coffee easily.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you to Steve and Diane, our hotel stay was fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: buddha55Chicago
Reviews.Content: We had a very large group staying over Saturday, November 14th and Steve and Diane were absolutely amazing and very helpful making our stay as easy and comfortable as possible. We really appreciated their kindness and efforts. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel and service! Location is quite dangerous if you are alone”
Reviews.Author: thebackpacker88
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay at the South Loop. Hotel : Rooms : clean, big, a tv, a desk, a very nice bathroom. PERFECT Service: personnel very nice, help you with anything! Location : dangerous if you are alone, don't go there. I was with another friend and we took cabs everynight. You need to walk to go to the subway (CERMAK/CHINATOWN) in the morning to visit chicago and then, to come back i advise you to stop at the previous station and then, take a cab. Cabs are everywhere in Chicago. In General : awesome hotel, I highly recommend it. Just be safe! Chicago is still a dangerous city in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a budget price”
Reviews.Author: KarenL1
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel though it is about 6 blocks outside of the south loop area so about a 30 minute walk to the downtown area. At Â£60 a night it was excellent value - large clean well furnished rooms & very friendly staff plus a great little coffee shop in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you don't want to overpay for a more downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Airportinhabitant
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights while doing a Chicago citytrip. Very nice and clean hotel with large rooms. Perfect location if you don't want to pay two or three times the price for a hotel downtown. The (public) bus stops in front of the door and for 2,50 it brings you downtown in 15 minutes. And free wireless internet... where the 'big' hotels downtown charge you up to 25 dollars a day for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: bubbaaaa
Reviews.Content: Found this through Hotels.com last minute before the Chicago Marathon. My wife, son, and I only wanted a room to sleep in and this hotel exceeded our expectations by far. Price was a steal (under $100/night), free parking, business center with printers, wireless internet in room, big bathroom. If you're looking for nightlife and amenities this place isn't for you, but for a comfortable bed in a clean room you can't beat it. The El was across the street from our 4th floor window and it disturbed my wife, a light sleeper. It didn't bother me, but I could hear it.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: nakitaisgood
Reviews.Content: overnight stay only. no premium movie channels. Breakfast was good and affordable - small sitting area. convenient to convention center (1 mile away). Overall, for the money, good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Affordable Hotel and very City-accessible”
Reviews.Author: KrisCo22
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a wedding in the Southside and the hotel was in a perfect location. It kind of appears out of nowhere and we walked through Chinatown to find it the first time. BUT, there is a bus stop right outside the hotel that does straight to State street and Michigan Ave for all of the touristy stuff. And the bus ran all night which is a plus, since not all of the lines do. The concierge was very helpful, but very busy that weekend and service could be slow at times. We had no complaints about the room except that it didn't come with a coffee pot. The snack shop in the hotel had excellent food though the service again was slow. There's a spa/salon, a computer room, a bar/restaurant, etc all in the hotel. Not much of a view but it was definitely a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “If you just need a bed, it's not bad”
Reviews.Author: jeemswai
Reviews.Content: Hmm. The good stuff. It was clean. Free parking in a well lit, fenced-in (not gated) lot. It was cheap when compared to the nicer hotels downtown, but it is by no means one of those nicer hotels. I stayed at a LaQuinta earlier in the week that blew this place away in all categories. The night desk girl was useless when we asked about a good blues bar and the best way to get uptown with out driving. "You have to take the bus." Well, duh. We tried venturing out but didn't have exact change for the bus (another detail that the desk clerk could have mentioned after we asked her where the ATM is; apparently this is common knowledge, but I don't take public transit often). So we went to the hotel bar which is like any other sports bar. The bartender was pleasant and they had plenty of TVs. The elevator makes scary sounds for only being a year and half old. The rooms are quite large actually, but there's not a whole lot in them. 2 pictures on the walls and they were the exact same picture. Not that I really care about a picture on the wall, but it gives a good idea of the attention to detail in this hotel and the barebones nature of the rooms. No in room information about the hotel, room service, etc. We had a restaurant menu from a restaurant not on the premises and a folder with printouts from the cafe. The printouts themselves were wrinkled and waterstained, unprofessional at best. The cafe was about the size of our room and done cafeteria style with the seating in a room across the hall. I didn't try the food because we waited for a few minutes and it didn't seem like anything was going on. No orders taken, no food coming out, no acknowledgment of us coming in the door. The line didn't budge. We got a couple waters from there later on and I'm not sure the woman said anything legible to us. All in all it was a little disappointing. It seems with a little more effort/investment it could be a great hotel. It was just missing a lot in the details. Like my title I would recommend it only if you just need a place to stay. Next time I want to hang out in Chicago I won't be staying at the Chicago South Loop. I'll spend the extra to be in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “much more than expected”
Reviews.Author: jeffrey9
Reviews.Content: Southloop hotel was a pleasant surprise. It was clean, well run, very professional. The staff was excellent especially a desk clerk by the name of Tommy Chen. The rooms were spacious with a large sitting area. The hotel also easily accessed various routes around Chicago. Anything that was needed the hoyel staff was eager to please; from coffee to taxis. The hotel was recently remodeled and very pleasant. My only negative would be the cafe. The staff was not friendly and the service was super slow. Otherwise, excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: RamblePeoria
Reviews.Content: A real surprise. If you know someone who is familiar with Chicago, they may tell you some stories about Chicago South Loop Hotel, but if you are in town and need a hotel, don't overlook this totally refurbished hotel that has been reopened for about a year and a half. Nicely decorated with large comfortable rooms and free parking. We booked through a discount broker and got a real bargain.
